title: Wanna be friends?
text:
I've been through some tough times the last couple years. I'm back on track and am getting my life back in order. The problem is most of my "friends" that I thought would stand by me, well, didn't. I'll be honest, I tend to work and keep mostly to myself but I'm more than tired of being alone. I used to have hobbies and friends but both seem to be hard to keep up without being healthy and having money to pursue. I'm getting more healthy and more money all the time.

I won't lie, I turned 50 this year and that probably has me feeling melancholy more than I should be. But I don't want to grow old alone and I seem to have a hard time, especially around here, trying to figure out where or how to meet new people and develop friendships. 

I'm not some kind of psycho, although I have thought about writing a manifesto. OK not really, I'm actually very friendly and can be fun to hang out with. At the same time I'm also kind of shy and can have a hard time talking, especially breaking the ice and initiating conversation. It sounds cliche' but it really is true that once you get me talking and I feel comfortable you may be sorry 'cause you may not be able to shut me up. 

I like lots of stuff food related....coffee, wine, cooking..... Also just about anything car related. I've had a couple fun ones in my time and I LOVE driving fast. I smoke an occasional cigar, sometimes very occasionally in the winter. I try to play golf, sometimes not very well but I enjoy getting out there anyway. 

I like to think I'm pretty amazingly perceptive. Somehow at the same time I seem to totally miss cues and tips when someone is trying to either be more than friendly with me or trying to get closer to me. If it's a distant situation I can read it like a cheap novel. But if it involves me I can be a bit of an idiot it seems. 

So anyway if you want to make friends with someone new and anything I said makes sense or strikes a chord then drop me a line. I'm honestly not holding out a whole lot of hope that this will work out but I'm taking the chance anyway. So don't let me down people!! Write to me!! :)

title: Bored? Take some time to read....
text:
Hello,

I am currently writing two chic-lit/paranormal/mystery romance novels. I would appreciate feedback as to which one I should focus on finishing first. Please email me if interested in reading the first 5,000-6,000 words of either/each.

Please note, these are initial drafts. Grammar, content, etc. have not been reviewed for publication. Any helpful criticisms/suggestions are most welcome. Thank you!
____

The first: "Wanted: Fairy Godmother - No Experience Necessary"

Synopsis: 

Hayden Parker, paralegal for Charles Abbot's Law Firm, is in a funk. She's educated, beautiful, and on the fast track to early retirement in the Bahamas. There is one big problem: she is also full of self-loathing, insecurities, and irrational doubt. Wishing for all the things she thinks would make her life better, she is caught by surprise when two mythical creatures appear in her bedroom one night. Transported through a black hole into parallel dimension, a dimension where magic is an every day occurrence, she soon learns that the only person she can trust is herself. Guided only by her intuition, she must solve the mystery of a centuries old spell before the magic that separates the two dimensions fades forever, putting both worlds in danger. 

____

The second: "Employed By E.V.I.L."

Synopsis: 

Fresh out of college Samantha Cartwright is headed nowhere in search of anything. Motivated by her significant student loan debt, she accepts a position with Enchantment and Voodoo Industrial Line (E.V.I.L). By the end of her first week she is filling orders for salamander eyes, bat toes, and dragon's saliva by the pint. However, as surreal as she finds the work, she learns that even magical companies have very real problems. Partnered with the rough and ruggedly handsome collection clerk, Blake, she is tasked with finding the source of espionage within the company. Soon she is struggling to understand the finer points of corporate politics, discover the company spy, not succumb to her budding feelings for Blake, and, most importantly, live to cash her first pay check.

title: Platonic only
text: Hey, thanks for clicking on my post. Hopefully this is the first step in making a new friend.. Unfortunately, my work and school schedules are crazy Monday - Thursday, so I'm hoping this will be a good way to meet some new, cool people. BTW, crazy weather we're having?!?! So, I know that this Craig's List and this section isn't really for platonic friends anymore; it used to be but I guess not so much now. However, I still have faith that there are still people out there, like myself, that are just looking for friends. Ok, I moved out here a few years back and I make some really good platonic friends on here back then. Unfortunately, they've either moved away to Ballard (you know some place so far away that they refuse to leave their new The Shire to come back to visit the old one) or they actually moved away (out of the area). Again just to be clear, I'm truly just looking for platonic friends to do stuff with. Absolutely no funny business. Period. I'm a laid back, non-smoking, educated, progressive, "lefty", black guy looking to expand my circle. Bottom line, I'm just looking for friends who would be up for grabbing a drink sometime, going to movies, running/jogging, soccer/flag football, working out, hiking, rock climbing and talking. Good conversation is essential; being able to discuss issues [and solutions] in technology, the environment, world events/affairs, non-commerical media, politics (again I'm a proud, educated progressive but very respectful of differing views). I know that's a crazy laundry list, but I'm truly open to meeting new, non-flaky people. If any of this sounds interesting and you're not a flake, please feel free to email me back. Thank you again for clicking and reading. I look forward to melting through the freeze and making some new friends.

title: Someone to visit with
text:
I am a married 56-year-old straight man who finds himself in a weird and painful situation. My wife decided, without discussion, with me anyway, to open her side of our marriage. At least that's how I see it. I won't be more specific than that here. We are currently living apart and are in counseling.

I am not here to find women to bitch about my wife to nor garner sympathy for my plight. I am here to try and find friends to email with, at first, perhaps phone conversations, and, if we sense some sort of connection, meet face-to-face, share a meal or a cup of coffee.

If you're curious, physical and other attributes can be seen in the grid to the right. I am not comfortable with putting a photo here and truthfully, sharing an image isn't something that would happen until we've communicated for awhile. 

Other, perhaps more interesting facts about me include a 30+ year in a local industry. I live in a house. There are no children or any other people living here. I don't drink, haven't for a very long time and don't mind if you do (within reason). I enjoy music, especially the blues, and my tastes are broad. 

If you've read this far, perhaps something about what little I've shared about my story and my desire for friendship will move you to respond.

I'm looking forward to it!

title: An Opportunity
text:
Hello,

I'm trying to manifest opportunities to build a life-long friendship with another queer woman. Maybe with two :-)

I am a 31 year old woman living in the Central District neighborhood of Seattle. I am married and we have one toddler-aged child. Our family was traveling a lot over the past few years and we returned to Seattle a few months ago to continue growing roots here and have the city be our permanent home base. While we were traveling, my two closest, local friends moved out of Seattle and so I get to practice putting myself "out there" and integrate the law of attraction for meeting people.

I somewhat like the activity of making friends. But with being the lead on logistics with my young child, I don't have the same access to real-world social spaces. I much prefer one-on-one relating. Mostly with people I listen, talk, cook, eat and laugh. Sometimes we get around to playing a game or watching a movie. In my time with myself -- which I cherish and need a healthy amount of -- I practice some form of art, listen to audiobooks (dystopian sci-fi, spiritual and sociological works), and watch shows from Amazon (right now, the "Newsroom" series). I would say I'm 50% extroverted and 50% introverted. I like having fun and being passionate about doing "good" in the world. I love playing sports and engaging with nature. I like doing things that other people are passionate about. Honesty/Authenticity and loyalty are very important ingredients for me in relationships.

I would like to connect with normal human beings -- who do not smoke :-/ By "normal" I mean people who have managed to resist or have undone (or are un-doing) all our limiting social programming. I operate on the premise that being racist or xenophobic isn't normal or natural. Any behavior that contributes to being disconnected or destructive to one's self or life around isn't normal. So while I am actively working on myself to meet folks with love wherever they may be at, I, quite frankly, want for myself a friend who practices self-care and has already done the foundational work on resolving their internal suffering. (It would also be great if you are available to relate in-person (in the CD) during the weekdays after 7 PM and/or early afternoons during weekends ;-).

If you feel intuitively aligned with the energy here, be brave and write me an e-mail.

title: Personal Trainer offering private/small group sessions
text:
Hello!
My name is Ryan and I'm a personal trainer trying to build my own, local client base.

I've been personally working out and passionate about health, physical fitness, and working with others in pursuit of their goals for over 11 years!

After working with friends for a few years, I decided this was a career path I really enjoyed and wanted to follow after. 
I've earned my certification and am now ready to start helping you change your life!

I specialize in weights/cardio/kickboxing/mma, much more geared to fun, applicable workouts to burn fat and build muscle quickly.

While I take an observant approach to help determine your current states and goals, I'm a very involved trainer and will do the workout right next to and with you.

Most of my clients prefer this way as it keeps more of a team effort than simply you doing workout with a drill sergeant yelling at you.

I'm listing several ads, trying all I can to get myself out and help others.

Please, don't flag my ads, competition is good for us all.
Please help support, or let your friends/family know who are trying to change themselves and their lives.

I want to and am passionate about empowering people to take control of their lives.

My workouts are fun, exciting, effective, and I'm excited to meet and help you realize your goals!

Please feel free to reach me by phone or text, email is also acceptable.
I have an open schedule due to training full time so 24hr gyms and schedules are even doable for night shift people wanting to improve.

My prices are extremely fair and I'm always willing to work with groups on price or buying a few sessions at once.
Please call, text, email with any questions.

Love and respect,
Ryan

title: wow, ladies I feel your pain
text:
Ladies, I truly feel your pain. I just checked out what cl has to offer for you all and I'm trying to stop laughing enough to write this. People asking for massages, making out, and all kinds of other things to do while being "platonic". It amazes me what this place has come to. Everybody looking for a quick hook up. It kind of makes me a little angry because I believe in this as a place to generally make new friends outside of your circle, meet people that you genuinely wouldn't meeting your day to day activities. A way to get to know someone without any bias or hangups. 
Now I ask you ladies, who here is tired of reading the same old "let's hook up" message hidden in these ads? How can actual real people looking for real friends get a chance to do that? 
I understand that men and women think differently, and I know that more men get on here than women. But I'm taking a chance to see if someone out there is willing to try and make a new friend. I want someone to take that challenge and try!

title: Must Love Dogs. Must Open Up Quickly
text:
As ridiculous as this post is, at least it is honest. I realize this could be a "bad" post for platonic, but I am looking for a friend. Whatever comes though, is good. 

I'm heading down to Greenlake with my puppy. I'm going to walk him (training), to read, and to kick back in the sun. It also appears that I am incredibly wound up. I just got out of a long relationship, so I'm not looking for anything serious right now. Ideally, I'll meet someone incredible and become really close friends. 

The kind of friend I'm looking for is open to anything. NOT just a friend with benefits, but instead someone who is willing to be really close. To cuddle on the couch, grab beers, or even just catch a movie with. A friend who is equally comfortable in a group, as just friends, or at home, incredibly close (when we need that). I'm looking for someone who wants to find us at Greenlake, hang out, and see how impulsive we are. 

Are you wound up too? Are you willing to make a new friend immediately? Can you cross boundaries and still go back (if needed)?

This could go down in two different ways:

A) The extra-fun/adventurous way - Let me know you're interested. Respond with a short message explaining who you are. I'll respond with limited information and you can find us.

B) The slightly safer/adventurous way - You respond with a picture, I will do the same. That way we both feel slightly better about physical attractiveness and not getting murdered in the park.

*note: I will not send a picture unless I get one, but have no problem doing so after-the-fact

About me: Professional, educated, fun, attractive. Though I would probably mix up that order if asked to rank. 

You: Attractive, educated, fun, professional. Though (again), the order is subject to change.

Come out. Find us. Play in the park.

title: why do certain things stop once you meg married!
text:
Life is hard enough just living it. With so many responsibilities you sometime sit and 
wonder "what the fuck" -- how did I get here? The twenties flew by and then "dum da da 
da" -- you're married. Then shortly after that is that baby crying and the whole 9 yards. 
Luckily I have older children but I still find myself daydreaming about the days I spent 
wasted on the couch listening to Pink Floyd's "Comfortably Numb" -- all those night with 
nowhere to go and nothing to do. 

Now, don't get me wrong, I have a great husband and I'm not complaining about his 
lack of love for me or anything related to that but there are things we just don't' share. 
Like my writing for example. Though I haven't written much lately, I have books of 
poetry and stories that he seems uninterested in. That's a HUGE pare of who I am. 
Well we all have a face that we hide away forever and we take them out and show 
ourselves when everyone has gone. We share so many secrets there are some we 
never tell. Tell them to me. 

As you know life at times it can be robotic, redundant, and now (for me) with dealing 
with a sick child (my son) is overwhelming and makes it even harder. I want to find 
someone who has a good heart -- a good soul. We can get to know each other and 
because we are in the same situation (with marriage and children) -- we might "get" 
each other in ways others don't. I've bared my soul to a stranger I met on the internet, 
not once, not even twice. I'm too open and too trusting. I'm sure that the only one who 
can close this "hole" inside of me is me, but having a special friend in my life wouldn't' 
hurt. 

Albert Einstein said that the definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over 
again and expecting different results. So does that mean I'm insane? For wanting to 
find someone out there who perhaps might share something similar. I call it 
perseverance which means "continued effort to do or achieve something despite 
difficulties and failure." 

If any of this resonates with you -- if you are someone who won't just disappear without 
a reason at least. Let's talk and see where it can go.

title: Gentleman seeks Surrogate arrangement
text:
This may seem strange (and this post may get Flagged) but I want to post it as part of my quest to father another child. 
I see posts on here from single ladies and gay couples seeking sperm donors. And yes, I have responded to them, hoping they might want to have a child using my sperm. No takers yet. 
Why? Well, for several reasons, I love children and while married, we had three great sons. We both hoped to have both a boy and a girl and planned to stop at two children. The first two were boys so we tried again with the understanding that this would be the last. Since my wife was having all deliveries by C-section, the doctor had to know at the time of deliver, if her tubes were to be tied. (in those days, they were unable or wouldn't determine the sex of the baby prior to delivery.) So, the directive was to tie her tubes at this, third C-section delivery. And again a healthy boy.

I have always been very pleased and proud of all three of my sons and they all finish college with advanced degrees, good job and great marriages. I always had the hope that they would provide me with a grand-daugther. Seven grandsons later,... and there isn't any plans for any more grand kids. 

I have since divorced and don't intent to remarry but still want to father a daughter. Of course, with the knowledge that the odds are still 50/50 that it could again be another boy. Not a problem since this child would still be loved and supported as were his/her siblings. 

I am retired now but still very healthy and comfortable in my life, but still have room in my heart, life and home for another child. In my optomistic life span projections, I can still provide for this child through college and it adulthood. Additionally, I offer my family genes/DNA, of high intellect and character.

So. There are my arguments. And here is the proposition. 

I am looking for a healthy, sober, drug free, caucasion lady, of child baring age. Single, partnered or married. I would like that this insemination be done either naturually or self induced insemination. I can't see any real reason to involve clinic or labs. (if at first we don't succeed, try, try again) Maybe, I'm over simplifing this, but why complicate that which is so natural! (aside from the use of a Surrogate, and even that is becoming a norm.)

If you (or even you & partner) are interested in this. Please contact me. There maybe other alternative parenting arrangements available in my or our quest to parent a child.

Sometimes I feel that I'm not into her, that I just enjoy the interaction because she's the only other female that I talk to other than my co workers and friends. This morning though, when she said hi to me, I started to smile like a fool. I really do like this girl. 

Thing is, I've lost my mojo and have become extremely shy and afraid to make a move. I'm afraid of the rejection. I used to not be like this, used to be confident and bold. 

I feel that I'm just overthinking it and should just go for it. But what if she doesn't feel the same, what if she's taken? What if she's just being nice to me because that's her job. I don't know what to do. I always try to talk to her as much as I can without keeping her from doing her job. 

So internet, what should I do? Should I make a move or just let it be?

title: Looking for that best friend thing I hear about?
text:

I am 25, married, stay at home mom of three kids (oldest is 3 years). My main hobby is gaming currently (mostly xbox atm) but I am hoping to find new hobbies =) Of course not a requirement but kids in the same age group would be wonderful... (too good to be true? lol) I am a bit unhappy with my weight and just recently purchased a treadmill and a elliptical/bike combo so maybe if you are looking for a work out buddy? Hubby works a late swing 5pm-1:30am M-F so I often find myself lonely in the evenings... Maybe we could go out at times but also I am often stuck at home with the kids (and it is more realistic with 3 little ones)... Looking for that friend I am excited to have come hang out... have dinner... just chill around the house...

When I'm just getting to know someone I am kind of shy... which can sometimes lead to rambling lol.... But really I am generally an unfiltered, honest, caring person =) Not sure what else to include... no way to get to know a person via a craigslist ad lol... Email if you think you wanna get to know me... we can exchange other contact info ect after email if we both want =)

title: Simply Friends
text: What is so hard to understand about simply wanting a new friend. I'll be the first to admit that I have been stuck in a rut for a long time, but I am looking to change that. I am 46 and been divorced for six years and the father of a teenage girl. I have full custody of her and wouldn't change a thing about it. Between her and my job I stay very busy. I am putting this out there not because I am looking for a relationship after all this is the strictly platonic section. I am just looking to find a new friend. At first I have a tendency to be a little shy and quiet, but I am open up as I get to know that person. If looks are important then maybe this is the wrong section to be looking in. That being said I may not be the perfectly good looking man most people seem to dream about, but I don't think I would send you away screaming. Lol. Who I am looking for her is someone who would like to chat through email or text or talk on the phone as we get to know each other. Then maybe dinner occasionally, movies, casino. Also, I would be interested in maybe going to the gym. It is one of my goals to get in better shape I just find it hard to find the motivation to go on my own. If I sound like someone you would like to get to know I look forward to hearing from you.

title: I wonder...
text:
Sometimes I wonder if you think about me. I wonder if you miss being in the back of my bike, and if you ever look to see if it's me when you hear the roar of one drive by. 
Do you ever miss just seeing my face? Do you ever miss our talks and wish we could we could catch up sometime? 
Those deep conversations, the fun times, and the food and drinks we shared, I do nothing now days. 
Look me up, I don't live where I did, but you can find me on Facebook. Drop me a line, and let's chat. 
No, I'm not a troll. I know I'm vague. But if you wish it were me writing to you, then take a chance and see if I'm still me.

Yes, I will admit that a lot of the fascination is sexual in nature, but not entirely. I feel about nothing else the way I do when a pregnant women walks by. My world stops and my focus shifts. It's actually a little disorienting, but kind of exhilarating at the same time.

Basically, I would just like to befriend someone who is pregnant. It would be very interesting and fun to have a pregnant email / txt pal for general conversation, etc. I will in no way expect anything more than friendship.... and understanding of an odd but otherwise harmless kink *chuckle*

At any rate, if you want to know more just shoot me a response. Even if that more is just being curious why I would go to such lengths for so little!

title: texting buddy++
text:
Howdy folks. I am in the market for a shiny new texting buddy, with the added option of escalating into activity partners. What the hell does that mean? Well, lemme tell you. It occurred to me the other day that I don't really have any friends up in the area outside of work. Well, I opt to change that. I'm just looking for someone to get to know and text throughout the day. You know, have that persom who you could feel comfortable talking about anything to, without fear of being judged. Someone to help pass time with, joke with, or bounce ideas off of. Whatever's clever.

Should both paties mutually agree that things click well, I am open to the idea of moving to activities together, as well. Movies, hiking, music shows, grabbing dinner, just hanging out, art projects, camping, it's all good to me. My goal here is to develop some new, local, and hopefully strong friendships. 

Who would probably jive with me best? Those that don't take themselves seriously and can laugh at just about anything, those that have a sense of humor, those who are genuinely curious and enjoy learning new things, those that enjoy new experiences, and those that know the difference between an argument and stimulating verbal discourse that involves the exchange of ideas that differ from yours and you can walk away with an appreciation of something new and different. If you have an appreciation for art and nature, are reasonably fit and enjoy running, hiking and other outdoor activities, and appreciate good writing, art, music, then dont be shy. If you're an artist yourself, or you enjoy going to metal shows, then what the hell are you waiting for? If most of that applies to you, then dont hesitate to say hi! 

That's enough babbling for now. If you read this far, I'll do you a solid in good faith. Simply reply back with something in the subject line that you'd like me to draw for you (think what you'd ask to be drawn on a pizza box lid) along with your texterer number in the email body. I will, in return, furiously scribble you a crude drawing with about 5 minutes worth of effort based on your request, and text you a pic of it. Don't expect Picasso. And I'll probably only do it for the first few responses. SO DON'T DAUDLE! Thanks for reading :)

And pardon spelling/grammar. I'm on mobile, and i refuse to proof read this longass crap post.

title: Need a friend/support buddy
text:
Note- someone replied to me and I didn't see til three days later, I tried to respond,but since my ad expired I don't know if you got my reply or not? Please let me know if that's you, there was only one person who responded to this

I've always struggled with feeling lonely. I have friends,but most of them are the kind of introverted people who enjoy lots of space and alone time. I'm an extremely extroverted person who gets clingy and wants daily communication if possible. It's easy to find people to talk to,but honestly these people rarely ever stay. They seem to just vanish,then I have to go find a new batch of chatting buddies,and I'm sick of this ugly cycle. I wish there could be a constant stable group of people I had daily communication with,who didn't change and leave after a few months.

I definitely want more female friends, women understand emotions, and they are better at being emotionally supportive.
I'm 27, single, no kids, struggling to get my life together. Could definitely use someone to talk to. I would prefer someone close to my age so we are in the same sort of life stage (though I'm aware more ladies my age have kids and a man and I cannot really relate to that,but I can't really relate to the 20-24 yr old crowd anymore either)
I struggle with depression,and would love a texting support buddy I could also meet up with occasionally for coffee and such.

title: F Seeks Conscious, Trauma-Informed, Mature Ear
text:
Hi and thank you for reading.

Looking for a trauma-informed and conscious, considerate friend. Eastside location. The last time I put a lengthy note here, it ended up on some Interent forum, where a bunch of folks were basically tearing me apart. With that said, perhaps it is best if you send a short bio to me, and I respond.

Anyhow, it is preferable it you are familiar with trauma, yet have not experienced a trauma yourself, as I am seeking a strong person to help to build me up. I don't have any support and the one friend I have is having a hardship, such is life. 

Moi: Age range - 28-37; mature, considerate, quiet, not a big phone talker, more of a listener, active learner, interested in metaphysics, yoga, healthful living (raw), hiking, and homesteading, non-toxic living etc. You don't have to be a perfect match, just please be someone who knows how to listen. For example if I discuss the trauma, I really don't care if someone you know has the same trauma. Most people I talk to keep blah blah my cousin, in-law has XXXX. Anyone who is sane will surely understand this frustration and desire to connect on a much less superficial level. There is this saying that goes, "When people talk about others to you, they will surely talk about you to others." So yes, I'm private, substance-free, and when not experiencing a trauma, concerned with living my own life in a quiet manner that reflects my own interests.

Also, while I live in America (won't state if citizen or non) I tend to get along with those who are not American born and have a much deeper perspective on life.
Thank you for reading and I hope to hear back~

title: Road biking partner (urban/rural)
text:
I'm looking for someone to explore more of the city with.

I've been riding in Seattle for about two and a half years. I know North Seattle best, but have more than a passing knowledge of downtown and Capitol Hill after a brief stint as a courier. I love taking new routes and different turns on long rides.

Anyways, as the weather improves (and the climate brings in the heat, sadly), I'd like to find someone to ride with regularly.

I think we'd work well as riding partners if:

--You like riding.

Getting out on the bike is the most important part. Whether it's into a head wind on a cold day or along fields of flowers with blue sky, I want to be out there. Each ride is its own experience and I like to enjoy it.

--You're a little competitive. 

I'm happy to cruise around a lake at easy paces, lazing in the sun, but I also want to take that turn up a random hill to see what's at the top. And maybe to see who gets there first.

--You don't mind silence.

I'm pretty talkative, but on occasion it's nice to listen to the wind and look at the scenery.

--You appreciate nature

Literally stopping to smell the roses is part of the ride. I like taking a moment to stop and admire a view or listen to what's around me.

I'm hoping to find someone who can do a 40 mile ride with relative ease, if a bit of effort. My usual shorter rides are around 15-25.

If you feel like you don't know Seattle well or if you're new to the area, don't worry--I'm happy to show you around some. I hope to eventually stretch out towards Everett and Redmond.

Hopefully you're around 20-24, but if you're older and think we'd work well, that's cool too.

Like coffee during a ride? So do I. It's a good place to meet, too. Send me an email and we can find a shop.

Lastly, if you're racist, homophobic, or sexist, I'm not interested. We don't need to be best friends to ride well together, but that's no fun for anyone.

title: Texting buddy +++
text:
Howdy folks. I am in the market for a shiny new texting buddy with the added option of escalating into activity partners. What the hell does that mean? Well, lemme tell you. It occurred to me the other day that I don't really have any friends in the area outside of work. Well, I opt to change that. I'm just looking for someone to get to know and text throughout the day. You know, have that person whom you could feel comfortable talking about anything to, without judgement or any of that noise. Someone to help pass time with, joke with, or bounce ideas off of. Whatever's clever.

Should both paties mutually agree that things click well, I am open to the idea of moving to activities together, as well. Movies, hiking, music shows, grabbing dinner, just hanging out, art projects, camping, it's all good to me. My goal here is to develop some new, local, and hopefully strong friendships. 

Who would probably jive with me best? Those that don't take themselves seriously and can laugh at just about anything. Those that have a sense of humor. Those who are genuinely curious and enjoy learning new things. Those that enjoy adventure and new experiences. Those that know the difference between an argument and stimulating verbal discourse that involves the exchange of ideas that differ from yours and you can walk away from with an appreciation of something new and different. If you have an appreciation for art and nature, are reasonably fit and enjoy running, hiking, and other outdoor activities, then dont be shy! If you're an artist yourself, salty and humorous language, or you enjoy going to metal shows, then what the hell are you waiting for? If most of that applies to you, then stop dilly-dallying!

That's enough yammering for now. If you read this far, I'll do you a solid in good faith. Simply reply back with something in the subject line that you'd like me to draw for you (think along the lines of what you'd ask to be drawn on a pizza box lid) along with your texterer number in the email body. I will, in return, furiously scribble you a crude drawing with about 5 minutes worth of effort based on your request, and text you a pic of it. Don't expect Picasso. And I'll probably only do it for the first few responses. SO DON'T DAUDLE! Thanks for reading :)

And pardon spelling/grammar. I'm on mobile, and i refuse to proof read this longass crap post.

title: Seeking 55+ friends closer to home - w4w or w4m
text:
I'd like to meet good people who live in Renton, south Seattle, Factoria, Newcastle, Kent and other areas within about a 15-mi. radius of Renton who are ~55 and up in age. Please be a reliable person who follows through after emailing, not so busy that you never can find time to socialize, and someone who plans to remain in the area. Thank you for reading the entire ad before replying to it with answers to the PLEASE NOTE paragraph below.

Are you looking for real, long-term, reliable friends rather than just acquaintances? I'm also ready to meet new friends closer to home who are kind and considerate to share good conversation and activities. How about you? Do you love nature and getting out into it? Art and music? Let's meet at a cafe for a conversation or get out for a park walk and chat on a good weather day and go from there.

People who are adventurous, will try new things and are curious about life in general are my favorite types of friends. My interests include almost anything that's outdoors in decent weather - good walks and hikes; having a good conversation; musical events; good movies, plants/gardening and public gardens; little road trips, and lifelong learning about all types of things including other cultures. Indoor pursuits like conversation over coffee, museums, dinner, talks, hearing music of many types and the like are great when the weather may not be cooperative. I'm hoping you share some of those interests and also want to meet someone who will share some of your unique interests and offers mutual support. I'm a non-smoker (you too, please) and occasionally have a wine or drink. We don't need any of this to have a good time, however. 

I'm a truly good person, have a sense of humor, and am a good friend who remembers birthdays, pays attention to what friends say, and tells them about news or activities I think will interest them. I'm also an empathetic person who will help friends in whatever way I can whenever I can. I'm intelligent, but not intellectual, have a spiritual side but am not religious. (No proselytizers, please) I'm reliable and look for other people who are too, as well as people who are kind, good people who have most of those qualities. Nobody is perfect, of course.

PLEASE NOTE: Please email and include where you are (city/neighborhood), a bit about your personality and interests, and days/time windows you're generally available to socialize. Please be close to the boomer age range and in the areas posted in the first paragraph above. If you'd like to send along your number in addition to a self-description to shortcut things, you can definitely trust me with it. 

If you're fit enough to get out for at least brisk walks, that would be great. I'm fairly fit for this age. I was born elsewhere, have been in the Northwest more than half a lifetime and have interest in meeting people from everywhere. If you're overly concerned with superficiality over substance, we very likely would not be compatible. Otherwise, I look forward to hearing from you soon! [Sorry, not looking to meet married people or couples. It doesn't generally work out that well.]

title: IT'S SPRING! Let's get out of the city!
text:
Now that we have nicer weather and more daylight, I'm looking for some people to join me in the great outdoors. Day hikes, snowshoeing, ski touring, mountaineering, backpacking, etc. I love to reach the quiet, pristine wilderness, which sometimes just requires a meandering walk along nice trails, and other times it takes 2-3 hours of driving followed by 15, 20, even 25 miles of steep hiking over rough terrain. I don't go anywhere dangerous or extreme though, partly because I'm usually carting a bunch of camera gear! 

So I'm looking for people who are in pretty good shape for those longer trips, but are also fine with the simpler outings. And you'll have to put up with me stopping occasionally to set up a tripod and take lots of pictures. But hey, I have a high-clearance SUV that I can drive, and I'll offer to plan everything, so you shouldn't complain ;) Or if you want to take the lead planning and/or driving, that's fine too! 

You should live near Seattle so we can easily meet for our trips, and we'd probably be able to relate better if you're somewhere around my age, say no more than 10-15 years apart. Other than that, just have a personality that's fun to be around :)
dislikes: Those big boxy things all around me
interests: Those big pointy things on the horizon.

title: You smoke them, I'd like the empty packs
text:
I roll my own cigarettes and use empty hard packs to pack and carry my smokes, my old packs are getting very worn!
I have acquired both the plastic and metal cigarette cases commonly sold in tobacco shops and online, but they aren't what I prefer or use. The reason is because with a cigarette hard pack I can just reach in for a smoke and lighter and light up in one easy motion, and there are enough people who want to bum my wonderful rollies as it is ;) . Those hard boxes they sell involve removing the pack from my purse and digging out a cigarette, complete with the scraping feeling that is not pleasant :( Also, those manufactured cigarette boxes don't load as easily as my reused hard packs. 
So there you have my reasons...
If you or anyone you know smokes non-menthol hard pack cigarettes and willing to pass the boxes along, please get in touch with me.
I am partial to Marlboro Lights, American Spirit or Camel packs, but I'm open as long as they're in good shape and not menthol!
I am willing to buy these if we can agree on a fair price.
I posted this under 'Wanted' and didn't get any response. In the spirit of posting in this platonic section I will add that if I met someone compatible who wanted to walk around the city smoking, as this weather gets nicer, I would think of that as a nice happenstance.

title: Seeking new friends (+ bonus 5 min art commission!)
text:
Howdy folks. I am in the market for a shiny new texting buddy with the added option of escalating into activity partners. What the hell does that mean? Well, lemme tell you. It occurred to me the other day that I don't really have any friends in the area outside of work. Well, I opt to change that. I'm just looking for someone to get to know and text throughout the day. I'm seeking the type of friend whom you could feel comfortable talking about anything to without judgement or any of that noise. Someone to help pass time with, joke with, bounce ideas off of, or to go off on adventures with. Whatever's clever.

Should both paties mutually agree that things click well, I am open to the idea of moving to activities together, as well. Movies, hiking, music shows, grabbing dinner, just hanging out, art projects, camping, it's all good to me. My goal here is to develop some new, local, and hopefully strong friendships.

Who would probably jive with me best? Those that don't take themselves seriously and can laugh at just about anything. Those that have a sense of humor. Those who are genuinely curious and enjoy learning new things. Those that enjoy adventure and new experiences. Those that know the difference between an argument and stimulating verbal discourse that involves the exchange of ideas that differ from yours and you can walk away from with an appreciation of something new and different. If you have an appreciation for art and nature, are reasonably fit and enjoy running, hiking, and other outdoor activities, then dont be shy! If you're an artist yourself, salty and humorous language, or you enjoy going to metal shows, then what the hell are you waiting for? If most of that applies to you, then stop dilly-dallying!

That's enough yammering for now. If you read this far, I'll do you a solid in good faith. Simply reply back with something in the subject line that you'd like me to draw for you (think along the lines of what you'd ask to be drawn on a pizza box lid) along with your texterer number in the email body. I will, in return, furiously scribble you a crude drawing with about 5 minutes worth of effort based on your request, and text you a pic of it. Don't expect Picasso. And I'll probably only do it for the first few responses. SO DON'T DAUDLE! Thanks for reading :)

And pardon spelling/grammar. I'm on mobile, and i refuse to proof read this longass crap post.

I'm definitely NOT trying to find someone to use or leach off of. I am currently unemployed but that is very likely to change soon since I am looking high and low for a job. We can go do inexpensive or free things for now, like go to parks, go hiking, watch movies or Netflix.

title: Platonic only - yes, I hope these relationships still exist...
text: Hey, thanks for clicking on my post. Hopefully this is the first step in making a new friend.. Unfortunately, my work and school schedules are crazy Monday - Thursday, so I'm hoping this will be a good way to meet some new, cool people. BTW, crazy weather we had last night?!?! Should be nice again starting tomorrow (Tuesday). So, I know that this Craig's List and this section isn't really for platonic friends anymore; it used to be but I guess not so much now. However, I still have faith that there are still people out there, like myself, that are just looking for friends. Ok, I moved out here a few years back and I make some really good platonic friends on here back then. Unfortunately, they've either moved away to Ballard (you know some place so far away that they refuse to leave their new The Shire to come back to visit the old one) or they actually moved away (out of the area). Again just to be clear, I'm truly just looking for platonic friends to do stuff with. Absolutely no funny business. Period. I'm a laid back, non-smoking, educated, progressive, "lefty", black guy looking to expand my circle. Bottom line, I'm just looking for friends who would be up for grabbing a drink sometime, going to movies, running/jogging, soccer/flag football, working out, hiking, rock climbing and talking. Good conversation is essential; being able to discuss issues [and solutions] in technology, the environment, world events/affairs, non-commerical media, politics (again I'm a proud, educated progressive but very respectful of differing views). I know that's a crazy laundry list, but I'm truly open to meeting new, non-flaky people. If any of this sounds interesting and you're not a flake, please feel free to email me back. Thank you again for clicking and reading. I look forward to melting through the freeze and making some new friends.

title: Gay male looking for best friend
text:
Gay 56 y/o male, artistic type (writer, painter, photographer) looking for a new best friend. I moved here from the Midwest two years ago, and the "best friend" position is still open.

I live in the U-District. I have a car. But if you live in, say, Vancouver, hanging out would be a challenge. Having just moved from the rural Olympics, I'd like you to live reasonably close the U-District, say a five-mile radius +/-?

I get along famously with younger gay men (25 to 45), but am open to a new friend of any age, really. Romance? Impossible to predict. But I treasure my friendships, both romantic and platonic. I don't flit around between scores of friends. I tend to hunker-down and invest deeply in a smaller number of friendships. Quality not quantity.

I am smart, quirky, funny. I like to talk and to listen; I'm a good listener. That's probably why my ears are so big. My last roommate observed that I regularly ask "life altering questions." That made me laugh. But I am a very curious person (which assists me in fiction writing). Almost always in data-collection mode. Some find it stimulating; others find it annoying. But the questions never really stop. Take it as a compliment that I am interested. And I can waste hours meandering through Wikipedia (alone, of course!).

One way I'm modern is I like to invent things, and I tend to be a technology early-adopter, or at least have early awareness of The Next Big Thing. I'm definitely not afraid to try new things. One way I'm old-fashioned: last Sunday I threw my modern smartphone out a car window onto I-5 South, near one of the casinos (yes, litter bug, just this once, 1,000 apologies). If my smartphone landed in the path of your car, a second 1,000 apologies. It was one of my "mad as Hell and not going to take it any more" moments. (Only old guys will get that movie reference. Yes, I'm gay and I like movies.)

But I don't enjoy the impatience and narcissism of texting (esp. in myself), and the rudeness when we are glancing at our phones every few minutes. That rudeness can damage a relationship -- like the death of 1,000 paper cuts.

So you could say I have one foot planted in the 21st century (some would say 22nd) and one foot planted firmly in the 20th.

Some examples of how I tend to be a tad TOO FAR into the future: I tried to invent what is today's Angie's List several years before Angie did. Damn that woman. I thought of what is known as YouTube more than a decade before it was created. Timing (and capital) are everything. I should have been one of the YouTube billionaires. If only I was a programmer.

I have a lot of life experience, lived through a lot. A lot of successes and more failures than I would have chosen, but we learn most from our failures, right? I feel like I have one more great game to play (vocational) between ages 56 and 70. So I feel like my best days are still ahead of me. Did you know more millionaires are made in their 50s than any other decade of age group? But money does not drive me anymore. If it comes, fine. I'm starting what the late Dr. Wayne Dyer (RIP) called The Senior Statesman part of life. Where I use everything I learned in my first 56 years to do something profoundly good.

Most of my career has been in public relations or photojournalism. This preoccupation with an occupation in art is new (well, old but dormant since high school). But some of my art is pretty good. My photos are widely published, and I just sold three paintings. Actually SOLD them! Imagine.

I was once married to a woman, and I have two grown wonderful children as a result. One of them is about to have my first grandchild. The reality won't sink-in until I hold the baby. But I do love babies and little kids. I love dogs and cats, too. Esp. cats.

I hope you are healthy enough to dance and take long walks or bike rides. Or join me on the occasional 2,000 foot climb of Mount Walker, south of my beloved Port Townsend, WA. Or sail. But I do not care if you have some dents and dings, some physical or mental challenges, or even HIV. (I do not happen to have HIV, but I am my supportive of my friends who do. In the late 1990s I let a research hospital do tests on me as part of the long search for an AIDS vaccine. It's unfinished business for the gay community.)

If appearance is important in your close friends, I am tall with broad shoulders (two), blue eyes (two), not esp. fat, and I am very white. Some hair is left (brown-gray), some has left for good. Pic-for-pic, as they say. But this needn't be predicated on appearance. This is a close friend I'm looking for.

If any of this appeals to you, please write. Best wishes y'all.

title: Non - Sexual Relationship

title: gay dude seeking real friends for this adventure called Life
text:
I grew up being the person who was always there for my friends - a trait I've carried over into adulthood. The friend you could call at 3am even if you just needed to talk to someone who cares ... the friend you could tell your darkest secrets to, who wouldn't judge ... the crazy, sarcastic, class clown who could crack you up or make you shoot milk (or beer) out your nose with laughter when you needed it most.

I'm a writer, gay male, who has always believed in the power of dreams ... provided you don't only leave them as dreams, but instead pursue them into reality. Even if you fail, it's so much better than not having tried at all. For that reason I have published my writing, acted on stage and in film and on TV (minor stuff, for real, but still) been to the top of both the Sears Tower and the Statue of Liberty, and even worked at Jurassic Park. To quote Julia Roberts in 'Steel Magnolias': "I'd rather have five minutes of something special than a lifetime of nothing at all."

All this life, all this doing my best to be there for others, has in turn taken a toll on me, and I hope to seek friends in Seattle. I'm relocating there in about two weeks, looking to get where I can sort of heal myself spiritually, physically, and mentally ... to get back to remembering that importance of living live day to day instead of feeling like you are always racing some clock you can never catch.

Seeking friends, creative or not, who are sincere, smart, understand the true meaning of friendship, and who also like to laugh. Probably a lot. Someone who appreciates good conversation and a ton of sarcasm, as well. Age, race, gender, what you look like - none of that matters as much as the person you are inside. 

Just ... looking for friends who are for real. Thanks for reading.

text:
I have found that making friends when you live out in the woods is difficult as there are not a lot of people here. My day to day interaction with people is limited except when I go into town. Here is a bit about me. I have no children but do enjoy them. I have two Boxers that I spoil rotten. I like to cook . I enjoy taking spontaneous day trips. . I have a passion for learning and am always interested in new and different things. I love going to fairs and festivals, (the tulip festival was outs "Harry Potter" series, second hand shopping is a favorite activity, , binging on Netflix on lazy days, I do a lot of paper crafting, mostly greeting cards, I take care of my chickens and turkeys. I live on a 20+ acre timber tree farm between Snohomish and Granite falls. My home landscape is surrounded by trees. I love it here, it is so peaceful. I am from Los Angeles, corporate America, and retired to WA 9 years ago. I'm 54 but on most days I feel younger or older, but then again, what does 54 feel like? My friends come from all age groups from 22 to 85. I don't care about your age, or what you look like or your sexual preference, these things should not be issues between friends. Let's just be friends and contribute to the quality of each othrs lives.

title: Friends? Puppy playdates?
text:
My name's Myfi! 

I'm a bit afraid of meeting new people, but I'm very friendly once I'm given the chance to get comfortable, I love to bake (and I will shunt many food-gifts upon you if you'll let me), I love tea , movies and animals(this includes reptiles. I own two. Be not afraid). 

I am generally relatively low-energy due to being out of shape and various other reasons, but if you have ideas for things to do I'm up for a fair amount of things! I am very blunt and fairly snarky, but I am an excellent listener and if you need someone to talk to about ANYTHING, I will sit and be a shoulder to lean on and will give generally sage advice upon being asked. I do have a long-term dedicated partner and we tend to spend our weekends together, so all of my free time is during the day (8am to 4pm) during the week. I also have the added benefit of having an adorable puppy who is SUPER high-energy and looking for routine playmates!

I do not drive, so relative closeness or a willingness to drive to me is wonderful, though I am equally content to make phone-friends or online friends! 

I'm not christian or religious and as long as you don't try to convert me I have no issues!
I am very libertarian and pro gun, so gun control supporters probably shouldn't apply. I'm incredibly prickly about being able to protect myself and equalize the playing field, as weak as I am physically.
I love all music except for rap. When I say all music, I mean everything from rock to metal to electronic to classical and opera to jazz and swing to disney music. As long as it's not Let It Go we'll get along great. I'm a bit of a budding audiophile as well!

I have a massive appreciation of nature which is a little ironic being that I've not been able to get out in it anywhere near as much as I'd like. 

The only thing I partake of to any degree is alcohol, and I'm insanely picky about it. I don't particularly have issues with anything you may or may not do, with the preference that if it's something illicit you not do it around me! I'm fine with pot smokers as well, but I ask it not be smoked around me(at least in an area where I would get the smell on me) as my partner is very sensitive and it would cause him to have severe nosebleeds :)

I'm told that I am a very giving and wonderful friend by what few I have scattered across the states and other countries! I'm fine with platonic snuggles and the like if and once you are(because who doesn't like to dogpile during movies, right? Especially when there's a cute pup!)

I mostly dream of raising tons of adorable baby animals, from reptiles to birds to mammals to insects! I am also obsessed with aircraft and many of the other Nicer Things With Engines that exist. Physics is good shit.

title: Dear Craigslist (cuddle buddy?)
text:
Dear Craigslist:

Before I start in on my question for all y'all, I just want to say a big Thanks. 4 months ago or so, I posted here about being lonely and about being utterly confused about the direction my life had taken. Almost uniformly, I got positive, thoughtful responses from you CL men, and it brought me so much comfort and I was incredibly grateful for the kindness. I'm really hoping you'll read about my idea/dilemma again and let me know your thoughts.

The situation: I'm single, and I've been single for a really long time. There are more reasons for why this is so than I care to list or you care to read about, but the reason I do want to mention is one that's pretty fundamental to a woman's success in dating: I'm not conventionally attractive. I'm 5'4" but I weigh 155lbs - which is just a little too heavy for most of the guys I hang out with (i.e. very social, active, educated guys who are themselves conventionally attractive.) I also don't carry this weight particularly well; it sits on my upper body rather than distributing evenly or going to my butt. While I know that the path to happiness involves self-acceptance - and believe me, I am pretty good at being self-accepting - I also know it involves becoming the best version of yourself. The best version of me is about 20 - 30lbs lighter than I am currently. If I get to that lower weight, not only will I look better on the outside, I'll feel better on the inside.

I'm doing most of the right things to be healthy and lose a little weight - I love fruits and veggies, I eat healthy fats, and I love lean protein and I do an average to above average job at avoiding fatty food. I'm active, and frequently run, hike, and play sports with friends. The weight is coming off so slowly, though, that I'm not really making any progress. I know, I know... the answer is to eat less.

If you're still reading, you're probably wondering why I have this listed in the personals section of CL. It's because I think having a cuddle buddy will help me lose weight. I love bear hugs, and I love giving and receiving physical warmth, comfort, and affection. I love having a man I feel comfortable with wrap their arms securely around me. As a chronically single girl, I've never really had anyone it would be appropriate to do this with, and that bothers me. I honestly believe that if I had someone to cuddle with and watch movies with in the evenings, someone who would distract me from food with cuddles and hugs, that I would focus less on the temporary joy that food brings me, and more on feeling physically good and physically connected to that person. I'd also honestly want to look and feel good for that person too. 

So, CL, what do you think? Should I approach a dude friend in my life for this, or would it likely get too emotionally messy for me and him? Should I try and find someone from OKcupid who'd do this for me? Would I be taking advantage or using someone if I found this? Would it inevitably lead to dating and sex? Should I find someone from here and hope that it leads to the kind of chemistry that can give this kind of comfort? How do I find this? Or am I just nuts to think this would ever be a good idea?

Sincerely,
Confused.

title: You know you're a dog person when...
text:
You Know You're a Dog Person When. . ..

•	Nobody's feet are allowed on the furniture, but your dogs are welcome to sleep on any piece they choose .
•	It takes an entirely separate garbage can to handle the poop.
•	All kinds of things around the house are in need of repair, but if your dog needs immediate surgery and out comes the checkbook.
•	You haven't had your annual check up in years, but the dogs are all medically up to date.
•	You're more concerned with the dogs' needs than your own when the budget gets tight. 
•	You can only remember people by associating them with their dog.
•	Your mom calls and asks how the granddogs are.
•	Every gift you ever get has something to do with dogs.
•	You rip up the carpet and lay tile to make clean up so much easier.
•	Your first concern when planning a vacation is whether or not the hotel will take pets.
•	You politely bow out of an important social engagement so you can attend to your dogs.
•	The number one priority when buying a new house is the size and landscape of the backyard. 
•	The cost of boarding your furkids equals that of your entire vacation.
•	Your desk proudly displays your canine family.
•	All dates must pass your dog's inspection.
•	The first question you ask when on a date is: "So, do you like dogs?" 
•	You break down and buy another pillow so you can have one to sleep on.
•	More than half your grocery money goes to dog food and treats.
•	You send out especially-made holiday cards that feature you and the dogs.
•	Your spouse issues the ultimatum: "It's them or me!" and you have no problem pointing out the suitcase.
•	Your dogs eat only the most nutritionally sound food, while your favorite meal is mac'n cheese.
•	You've just spent $60 on groceries and realize none of it is for yourself. 
•	Your "Welcome" sign has a dog on it. 
•	You have a kiddy wading pool in the yard, but no small children. 
•	You have baby gates permanently installed at strategic places around the house, but no babies. 
•	Poop has become a source of conversation for you and your significant other. 
•	Your dog sleeps with you. 
•	You like people who like your dog. You despise people who don't. 
•	You talk about your dog the way other people talk about their kid. 
•	You put an extra blanket on the bed so your dog is more comfortable. 

How many of these can you relate to? Anything you can add to this list?

It would be nice to have a friend who can understand and relate to life with dogs!

title: Looking for new friends
text:
I am a married 56-year-old straight man. I'm at a point in my life where it feels like I've just awakened from a dream only to find that the dream bears only some correlation to reality. Specifically, my wife decided, without discussion, with me anyway, to open her side of our marriage. Did not see that coming. Or perhaps I did and had no clue what to do about it. We are currently living apart and are in counseling.

I am not here to find women to bitch about my wife to nor garner sympathy for my plight. I am not looking for sex as part of a vendetta against her and her partners. That's why I'm posting in this section vs others. I am here, sincerely, to try and find friends to email with, at first, perhaps phone conversations, and, if we sense some sort of connection, meet face-to-face, share a meal or a cup of coffee. Simply that, without expectations, strings or entanglement. With honesty, laughter and the sharing of stories. 

If you're curious, physical and other attributes can be seen in the grid to the right. I am not comfortable with putting a photo here and truthfully, sharing an image isn't something that would happen until we've communicated for awhile. 

Other, perhaps more interesting facts about me include a 30+ year in a local industry. I live in a house. There are no children or any other people living here. I don't drink, haven't for a very long time and don't mind if you do (within reason). I enjoy music, especially the blues, and my tastes are broad. 

If you've read this far, perhaps something about what little I've shared about my story and my desire for friendship will move you to respond.

I'm looking forward to it!

title: Warped, Wicked, & Irreverent
text:
Intelligent, educated, professional, WM with a truly wicked sense of humor and a flair for the erotic, seeks an e-buddy to build synergy and to resonate with.

I get bored as hell at work because I do the same thing over and over. Sometimes the only thing that keeps me out of the loony bin is chatting it up...texting, email, IM, talking on the phone...Hell it could be smoke signals (no, not THAT kind of smoke), carrier pigeons, or bongo drums and I'd still enjoy it.

What I'm looking for is to make a connection...To have that spark happen when intelligent conversation and flirting are mixed together with the rush of meeting somebody new. BOOM! Explosive?...Oh hell yes! I love it!

So then what happens, you ask. Well, I'm separated and I'm definitely not looking to change anybody's situation while I figure out mine. I'm really not expecting that we hook up, date, or even meet for an ice cream sundae at a church social (I've never done it in a church, lol...Have you?). At the end of the day, I'm just hoping to find a gal pal who both enjoys some male attention and giving a guy that same attention. Anything beyond that...let's cross that bridge if we ever get to it.

So let's talk about you: A woman (sorry guys, nothing personal, I just don't swing that way), 40-60 (the age is just a suggestion because we're likely to have more in common...but if you're under 40 or over 60 and you think you're up for the challenge, then by all means). Race, looks, religion, occupation, politics, astrological sign, blood type, favorite football team, etc etc are unimportant. Marital status...that's an interesting one. I prefer you to be married or divorced...But, as with the age, if you think you're up for it, then by all means.

Turn On's:
A.) A woman who has a sense of humor as warped and irreverent as mine (You can laugh at almost anything).

B.) A woman who doesn't need me to carry the conversation all the time (aka isn't afraid to speak her mind).

C.) A woman with something going on upstairs (aka you know what synergy and resonance mean...or at least you're motivated enough to crack the dictionary).

D.) You're a fan of flirting and being flirted with. If you DON'T, let's not waste each others time.

Turn Off's:
A:) If you're somebody who thinks that bored people are boring, then carry your ass, sister. You're probably a princess and I don't need the headache.

B.) Likewise if you're going to be offended by my self confidence and think it's arrogance or conceit. If that's offensive or threatening, keep moving. There's plenty of gals who like self confidence in a man.

C.) Ditto on preaching about morality. If I want a lecture, I'll go to the aforementioned church and try that ice cream sundae.

D.) Nit Pickers. See A, Princess types for details. I'm not here to try and fix what's wrong with anybody and I sure don't need somebody doing it to me.

The rest of you gals, crack that dictionary, look up synergy, and drop me a line ;)

title: Friends only...well with some snuggling
text: Let's face it, at our age, there are a lot of us whose body parts aren't cooperating. My knees are killing me:-( And due to a drug given to my mother during her pregnancy with me, my intimate parts don't work correctly anymore. It has stopped me from posting in the romantic section. But I miss male companionship and affection. We both just see our malfunctioning body parts as a natural part of the aging process of life instead of a loss, and neither one of us is going to let that stop us from having a close, loving, fun, long-term relationship. I'm 63 years of age, 5' 5", divorced, have waste long brown hair, a few more pounds than I would like (but not obese), very healthy (no high blood pressure, no high cholesterol, no diabetes). Things that I like to do: I love live shows of all kinds (plays, comedy, opera, concerts, restaurants with live music, etc.), science (especially archaeology, and astronomy), museums, the beach, Sunday afternoon trips, cozy warm snuggling by the fire, cuddling while watching a movie, good wine, ethnic restaurants and dancing. Hoping to spend some of the winter months in Hawaii or Arizona in three years when I retire. Want to visit Egypt and Italy, and would love to explore the U.S. in an RV someday (I especially love the Southwest). I am happy, secure and independent. I love going out with my friends and won't give that up, but miss the companionship and affection of a man. Most importantly, we both love to laugh! If you think you want to try to make me laugh, tell me something about yourself and send me a photo. I will send you a photo and more about myself, if I think there will be a connection (no photo, no reply). title: It's Spring! Everyone is twitterpated~
text:
I can't believe that's a real word. I thought Disney made it up!

Anyway, I've been hermit'ing most of the winter (and last year) but am finally feeling better enough to poke my head out and see what's going on! The warmer days and the sun are doing their best to convince me it's roadtrip season... buuuut I'm getting kind of tired of roadtripping alone. I'm thinking the Tulip Festival before April is over, perhaps a trip up to Canada (beyond Vancouver) for 4th of July weekend, and... whatever else catches my / my new friend's fancy!

The main thing is that my new BFF and I are comfortable with / can talk to each other. I'm weird, I know it, and I've had a looooong time to come to terms with it. Nonetheless, I have my good points. I'm a good listener and I have pretty good cheering-up skills. I'm quiet when I have nothing to say. Occasionally I give good advice. I can be witty and funny. I'm self-sufficient. I would say something about having a car, but it's nearly 20 years old, so...

I have no conditions, except that you be able to hold a conversation. :) Happy Tuesday! .... just 3 more days 'til the weekend....

title: Tuesday escape?
text:
How about a scene upon Norwegian Cruise Lines, Maiden of the Seas? Its our 15 year anniversary trip and I thought it would be good to get you away for a while. Of course, after 15 years, we have sort of settled into a bit of a rut, but lately we've been spicing it up with some interesting conversations regarding wife sharing. To my complete surprise, you didn't drop your jaw on the ground or run off in a huff when I casually mentioned that I'd had a dream about it. But until this point it has all just been talk. However on our 2nd day headed to the Bahamas, the boat is still 8 hrs from the next port of call. You are lying in a lounge chair by the pool and I'm trying my hand at some blackjack at the casino. My phone buzzes and its a text from you. "Hey, remember what we had been discussing...your dream that you brought up?" Me: "Yeah, what about it?" then a pic arrives on my text. It's a guy in swim trunks standing by the edge of the pool with a towel over his head as he's drying his hair. What is unmistakeable is the enormous outline in his tight, wet trunks. 

me: "Good greif, monster at sea" I respond. 

you: "giggle" 

me: "So why did you send me that?" 

you: "why do you think, silly?"

title: Seeking friend who could be fwb someday
text:
I am looking for a lifetime friend. I dont get out much in social situations, I am kind of a loner. So I figure chances are maybe someone out there is also thinking craigslist might be a good place to find a friend. Or maybe someone is looking for someone like me. I am a complicated person, I dont get along with many people. I am a female, but I consider myself to be genderfluid, It has been a very long time since I have been with a women, I am in a commited relationship. But I am looking for a female friend that I can be friends with for a very long time, while at the same time we could have w on w time and then maybe bring you in to be apart of a threesome with my boyfriend. I am not dishosest or a liar but I am a private person, my boyfriend knows I am doing this but know one else does and I would like to keep it that way, so your picture gets mine if you are interested. I am looking for someone who is bisexual and could fool around or do a threesome eventually one day. If you cant ever see that happening please dont respond. 

I am the best of both sides. I love outdoor activitys such as hiking, camping, fishing, rock hounding, long walks, biking, swimming. Other things such as photography, video games, all forms of creativity, drawing, coloring, creating, writing, gardening, sewing, cooking. While I can get down and dirty in the mud and withstand the pain. I can also be girly and like to dress up and take pictures and go out. I love animals and plants especially more than most things in life. 

I have been on a path to enlightenment, I do struggle with depression and anxiety, but I am looking for someonme who is positive and not interested in creating or fueling drama. I have been working on fixing my own inner problems for some time, I do fairly well on my own. I am a great listener and can listen and give advice if you have troubles. But no unnessisary drama, I am confident and a secure person with myself and my body. I have been taking steps to better my body while I have been bettering my mind. I am not a hater and I dont need them in my life. 

I plan on doing a lot of camping this year and it would be nice to have a female friend to bring along. I am not interested in doing a threesome right away, this is mostly for a friendship where that could be possible. I am a bit chunky but I am porportaniate. I dont have many preferances to what you look like as long as you can keep up with me.

I like to think I am funny, adventurous, laid back. I find the smallest and most unusal things entertaining. I know I am a strange person but that doesnt stop me. I work 5 days a week and my hours are flip floppy but I like to go on long walks around my neighborhood. I dont mind doing things around the house every now and then too. The weather is no obstacle for me, I will go out in any of it for a walk or anything really. I love living life, I think everyone should experience most things at least once, I am very 420 friendly, I go to hempfest every year and various other festivals. I dont do hard drugs and I drink occasionally. I love listening to interesting music and I have been teaching myself to dance. My boyfriend and I are very adventurous together, we enjoy going to parks or the outdoors and finding places to have sex. That would be a very big plus to be able to do that with my good friend one day. The three of us doing naughty things in public nature. 

I have had and lost many friendships in my life just from compatibility problems. I am very open and non bias, I can feel comfortable talking about just about anything. I am very opinionated but I dont try to shove them down your throte, its ok for people to have their own opinions. We can start by just emailing or hanging out. If I seem like the type of person you would like to be friends with, I promise you wont regret it. 

If your interested please inquire with your favorite animal as the title. And I will get back to you.

title: Weekend companion 4/22-24
text:
Professional male coming to Seattle on Friday 4/22 for a work trip, but I'm coming early to walk around the city and explore. I'd love a travel companion for the weekend. I like to walk and explore, regardless of the weather. We can grab a craft beer in a pub for lunch, see the sights (maybe take a ferry across the sound to explore outside of the city) and then have a cocktail before a good dinner with e nice red wine. I like to watch people (serious amateur photographer), i like to see the places tourists don't see and I like to learn about the history of a place. Throughout the day, I will tell you absolutely everything about my life and hope you will do the same. There is nothing that helps people become instantly intimate than the anonymity of not knowing each other and knowing that we will soon part ways; it gives you freedom to say anything. I tend to click best with women in their 30's who have a liberal arts type of education or something in the social sciences area, though scientists and engineers are also fascinating, as is a barista who gets to watch people all day. Just be interesting and not bitter. Who has time for that. For our little adventure, I will pay for everything, including Uber to get you to and from home.

A little more about me: I'm a white male, professional with a grad degree. I am a consultant with a unique niche, which we can talk about later. I travel a fair bit. I'm in my late 40's, 6'2" and tend toward the beefy side. I'm married and have kids. Again, there's a story there (isn't there always?!?) but my kids are my main focus, which is why I'm still married. It's a mutual agreement. People tell me that I'm kind and amusing and that I listen well, though I can talk too much. I was in the navy as an officer and that helped me to see the world (yes, the cliche is true). I've been to Europe, Central America, the Mideast and SE Asia. The world gets more amazing the more you see of it...

So,. what do you think? Interested? If so, shoot me an email with a photo and ask me anything. I'll return a note to you with a few photos of me.

title: Eccentric loner with chronic illness looking for a friend
text:
Hey there, Im really finicky with people in general, I literally talk to two people in person in my life, my gf and best friend. I keep trying to make a second friend but its really hard for me. I hate most people, I dont get along with them nor care for more friends really, but its hard feeling so shut off from the world sometimes. I also seem to attract a lot of sociopathic people, And im extremly sick of them, so if youve been called one, please dont bother me. Ive tried having compassion for them because thats considered a disorder, but im done doing that and feeling bad for people who get off on fucking other peoples lives over, my empathy is far better used on people who arent the REASON the world is so fucked up I dont even leave my house unless I have to. 

Anyways, I tend to rant about the shit world a lot, I live with chronic illness- I have a connective tissue disorder so some days are harder to get around then others, but I can do cool tricks like the bendy pics in this post ha. Also have schizoaffective disorder which makes me a bit extra paranoid of people and reclusive. Im an artist.. I feel like Im writing an ad for a dog with issues or somehting ha. I dont know how to communicate with people on the "socially acceptable level" The whole hi how are you?- oh Fine you? - I hate idle chatter and how we all just go through these shit fucking motions in life, never really tapping into eachother on a human being level. Im not a robot, and I feel like nearly every person I talk to in public are just empty shells on autopilot, its creepy and reminds me why I almost never bother to seek any other people in my life out. 
Anywhat, preferably Id like someone around my age- though I usually get along with way older people a ton better, I think id be more nervous to met someone whos like 70 online ha. In person I see to get along with them better then most shit nose young people. I may be eccentric and look like that type of person, but Ive been told by even my own family that Im like an old man about things. Ha and then I even sometimes use a walker hahaha, Im not your average person lets just say.

Each day goes by
A routine existence
Autopilot
Cruise control
A pleasant drive down an endless road
Nothing new
Nothing noteworthy
Nothing to sit up and take notice
Nothing
So we do things we are not supposed to do
We sneak away
Imagining
Our limits
Our motivations
Will we
Or won't we

If only there was someone with whom to chat...
