title: Warped, Wicked, & Irreverent
text:
Intelligent, educated, professional, WM with a truly wicked sense of humor and a flair for the erotic, seeks an e-buddy to build synergy and to resonate with.

I get bored as hell at work because I do the same thing over and over. Sometimes the only thing that keeps me out of the loony bin is chatting it up...texting, email, IM, talking on the phone...Hell it could be smoke signals (no, not THAT kind of smoke), carrier pigeons, or bongo drums and I'd still enjoy it.

What I'm looking for is to make a connection...To have that spark happen when intelligent conversation and flirting are mixed together with the rush of meeting somebody new. BOOM! Explosive?...Oh hell yes! I love it!

So then what happens, you ask. Well, I'm separated and I'm definitely not looking to change anybody's situation while I figure out mine. I'm really not expecting that we hook up, date, or even meet for an ice cream sundae at a church social (I've never done it in a church, lol...Have you?). At the end of the day, I'm just hoping to find a gal pal who both enjoys some male attention and giving a guy that same attention. Anything beyond that...let's cross that bridge if we ever get to it.

So let's talk about you: A woman (sorry guys, nothing personal, I just don't swing that way), 40-60 (the age is just a suggestion because we're likely to have more in common...but if you're under 40 or over 60 and you think you're up for the challenge, then by all means). Race, looks, religion, occupation, politics, astrological sign, blood type, favorite football team, etc etc are unimportant. Marital status...that's an interesting one. I prefer you to be married or divorced...But, as with the age, if you think you're up for it, then by all means.

Turn On's:
A.) A woman who has a sense of humor as warped and irreverent as mine (You can laugh at almost anything).

B.) A woman who doesn't need me to carry the conversation all the time (aka isn't afraid to speak her mind).

C.) A woman with something going on upstairs (aka you know what synergy and resonance mean...or at least you're motivated enough to crack the dictionary).

D.) You're a fan of flirting and being flirted with. If you DON'T, let's not waste each others time.

Turn Off's:
A:) If you're somebody who thinks that bored people are boring, then carry your ass, sister. You're probably a princess and I don't need the headache.

B.) Likewise if you're going to be offended by my self confidence and think it's arrogance or conceit. If that's offensive or threatening, keep moving. There's plenty of gals who like self confidence in a man.

C.) Ditto on preaching about morality. If I want a lecture, I'll go to the aforementioned church and try that ice cream sundae.

D.) Nit Pickers. See A, Princess types for details. I'm not here to try and fix what's wrong with anybody and I sure don't need somebody doing it to me.

The rest of you gals, crack that dictionary, look up synergy, and drop me a line ;)

title: Seeking Day Trip/Museum Friends
text:
I am 63 years old, divorced in Dec. 2013. While I have a number of friends that I go to movies, dancing, plays and even the opera with, I am having a hard time getting my friends to do other activities due to work schedules, their lack of funds or their lack of interest. Those activities include day trips to places like LaConnor, Leavenworth or some of the upcoming summer fairs, concerts at Chateau Ste Michelle, museums, National Geographic presentations at Benaroya and more. So I am looking to expand my circle of friends with people who enjoy such activities.

I am originally from NY, though I've been in the Seattle area for 28 years. I am small business owner of an event decorating service for the passed 16 years. I am agnostic, and do not believe in organized religion. I have a 29 year old son and two Shih Tzu fur babies. I live in Lynnwood, but lived in Seattle for many years, in the Matthews Beach/Wedgwood neighborhoods. I don't have a problem traveling, it's only 20 to 30 minutes, and I love going to Seattle and do a lot of activities downtown. 

I enjoy good science fiction, action movies and movies based on true stories (not really fond of most chick flicks, though I am willing to go if that is a friend's choice). I enjoy "real" science too (favorite subjects include ancient Egypt, dinosaurs, the Universe); also history, art, jazz, comedy shows. I love seafood and ethnic restaurants. I'm a documentary addict. I love Neil DeGrass Tyson (and was a huge fan of Carl Segan). Most of the books I read are non-fiction, as I enjoy learning. I'm not athletic, though I don't mind watching important sports games, or going to stadium games. I enjoy old car shows and old car museums. When I retire, I'd love to travel in an RV for a while, as I love West/Southwest National Parks, especially Yellowstone and Bryce. I used to think I'd be doing that with my husband, but now will have to find friends who want to do the same, or do it myself (I am already making plans to tow a teardrop trailer behind my Mustang, just in case). I also want to travel to Italy, and want to go on a tour in Egypt with Dr. Zahi Hawass. I have a time share in Maui and would love someone to go there with me sometime.

I prefer female friends to be between 45 and 70. I can't stand smoke of any kind (cigarette, cigar, pipe or pot smoke), don't do drugs. I am NOT 420 friendly. Please tell me something about yourself. Let's get some communication going.

So yeah... if you wanna chat and see if we click hit me up! I have nothing but time. We can talk about any thing. :-) Im not looking for a pen pal. I dont wanna email my summer away. Summer is almost here and I wanna be enjoying the sun and having fun!

title: I need to talk and have a shoulder.

Seriously, what the hell. 

Anyway, Hi Ladies!

I'm almost 27 years old, getting married in September to my fiance of almost 7 years, and we are expecting our first baby in October. Needless to say, it's a huge year for me and while I'm overwhelmed, I'm extremely happy and excited and am hoping to find a mom or two to commiserate and share life with. :)

I would be so happy to find a few friends to exercise with (at the Y, go for walks, take classes, etc.), have coffee or wine with (in October, anyway..damn!), swim with, take lessons with, craft with (I'm all about trying to save money and DIY), and just be myself with. I like to joke around, cuss, make light of stressful situations, and stay as positive about life as possible while not taking myself too seriously. 

I get along with just about everybody I meet because of my friendly, outgoing, and compassionate personality, but I definitely have a line that I draw when it comes to certain people. I am all for cussing and ranting and raving and getting your emotions out, but if you are rude and like to make fun of or put others down, have a lot of drama but don't want to try and fix it or make your life better, overly dramatic about everything, ungrateful, pessimistic, fake, full of yourself, or super quiet, we may not get along. At all. I just want to meet some genuinely nice, funny, cool people. Can't be that hard!

If I sound like someone you could tolerate, I would love to hear from you! Tell me about yourself and your family, what you're wanting to get out and do this summer, your likes/dislikes, etc.

Thanks for taking the time to read and I look forward to meeting some awesome people! :)

Enjoy raunchy jokes, burping, farting, overall guy things, yet I can clean up nice if I'm going out on the town. I really can get along with anyone. 

Note: if all you're looking for is to text and email and never meet "in real life" then don't bother wasting my time. Yes we all get busy and need to work around schedules but I'm not looking for a cyber friendship.

Into: music (hip-hop R&B, techno, alt. rock, Michael Buble/top 20 modern stuff/80s 90s music/some country and many others!)books (got a kindle fire and it's freaking awesome to take books with me (Harry Potter/Dean Koontz/Stephen King/Bourne Identity series/Lord of the Ring series and man others!)bars/clubscoffeeroad tripsmotorcycles (just got my endorsement with another bromance bud)hot girls & guys massage animals (I have a small Schnauzer)honesty masculine (it's cool if you're gay just don't be a queen)cars/bikes/anything fast, like import carscampinggoing to the lake cooking (gourmet foods)technology (cell phones, E readers, computers, etc)finance and investments/budgetsPlus if you:already have a passport (Canada!)have an animalalready know how to ride a motorcycle/own onemasculinenon-smokerare emotionally and financially stable (I pay my own way when we go out, unless otherwise discussed)smart/educated (but I'm no snob)good looking good wing-mainly looking for an overall good buddy to explore life withclean/good hygeine (you'd think this would be a given) your own method of transportation or at least a transit card. I'm pretty sarcastic and like to socialize. 

Love to text when I'm out of town for work (or talk on the phone normally. what's with those people who ONLY text, and act like they're afraid to call someone?) Looking for good buddies for above-all friendship/bonding (just like the title states). Shoot me a line, describe yourself, send a pix (I will return the favor), and your interests/hobbies. If you're married and discrete, the secret is between us (believe me I know the deal). Into all types of guys, white/latino/black, just as long as you're not a douche :0) Be local or some where in my ballpark of location (the entire south sound, or Seattle itself, even). 

Let's get to know each other. Type "bromance" into subject headline of email so I know you're not those annoying ads........thanks guys! Happy Craigslisting! I'm not religious and can't stand religious dogma, but I am spiritual. I believe in energy and reincarnation. I have a naughty sense of humor so I am NOT PC. I've been happily divorced for 15 years and have done it ALL on my own since then I was a single mom that raised her son by herself so I'm strong but he's now in the Navy. 

I'm finding myself lonely for female friends to hang out with. I'm 47 but I'm still young at heart. I don't smoke and can't be around it, it gives me migraines. I don't do drugs and drink socially. Watch these 90's moves go, baby! Let's walk the Centennial Trail, I've got good sneakers :) Karaoke? Totally! I have 2 kayaks so let's paddle Lake Stevens in the evening and grab a bite after.

All I ask is that you be yourself and looking for a strictly platonic friendship.

I am heading to Georgetown, as it is pretty close to where I live, and seems to have the kind of establishments I like to go to. I am not a big drinker, and I don't go out very often. Mostly I have been focusing on my work, and starting over, so I have not had a lot of extra money for such things.

I tend to be a pretty gregarious type, for the most part. I find it fairly easy to make friends wherever I go. Most likely this is a product of my upbringing in an environment that was constantly changing. My step father changed jobs very frequently, so we moved around a lot. I have a very wide variety of interests, and I like a good conversation. I have a pretty good vocabulary, and I am fairly worldly, as well, so I can talk about anything you like.

title: Want your opinion on a Massage offering
text:
One request: Please don't flag:)

So, I have posted couple of times on CL offering a free massage.

I used to do this quite a bit earlier in another city (moved here 4 yrs ago) and I would easily find folks to trade massages with. If nothing, it'd be at least a one way massage. 

It was so strange - for both my ads, I got like one response...lol. 

Thought - I was doing something wrong so thought of seeking feedback. What would be a concern seeking a platonic massage through CL? 

I mean, Massages are fairly expensive so a free one should be interesting, right? As for safety, I first offer to meet in public, talk on phone and even keep the first massage as simple as possible - for example just arms or just neck. No full body or anything that'd make you uncomfortable with a stranger. I can also offer couple of references from my friends in NYC who I have done this with. Not once have I crossed the decency line. I'm a gentleman with a normal life, job, education etc. High hygiene and to those it matters, I look decent too.

Why I do it - its fun really. Meeting someone new and the possibility of finding a massage trading partner is awesome. I enjoy the touch - giving or receiving but have zero expectations beyond that. Relaxation and the chat and the idea of meeting someone new is just awesome!

Overall, its full transparency so wanted to know what could I still be missing in my offer?

Any and every feedback is welcome - feel free to just curse me too:) Even that is a feedback!

title: anonymous online
text:
This meeting of traitors anonymous is called to order.

Hello, my name is Giaus and I am an enemy of the United Kingdom. I wasn't naturally born an enemy of the United Kingdom, I was made one by my family, my education, the circumstances of the stars in the sky at the hour of my birth. I still remember clearly my early upbringing in the way of revolution. I was only about five when my mother first told me of my destiny. We were riding in a car, travelling from Seattle to Olympia. 

"This is the United States" she said solemnly, with all her love. "This is an independent country." It sounded so serene. "Independent country", I loved the sound of it. Then she went on "We're independent of Britain." Oh, it was a beautiful summer's day. By the time out trip to the State Capitol was over, I was thoroughly entranced by the majesty of the republican law, the due process, the jurisprudence. It was so perfect and all inspiring that by the time she got me home I had decided to totally destroy Britain, whatever the bleep that was, for denying it's right to exist way back in the 1700s.

I look back on my life, and I look around this meeting, at all the other anonymous e-people. Do I really want to be here? Do I regret being an enemy of the United Kingdom? Perhaps there are times. But then I think about the British themselves. After all, they are all indoctrinated, as I was. They are my enemies, sworn to destroy me as a traitor.

I could never be friends with England, that would be impossible. After all the time I've put into being a republican, a citizen. And yet I look back on my life with sadness. All of the conflict, all of the strife. 

I don't know what I hope to find here. Not a conspiracy, I hope, not another crime against my tory neighbors. Maybe there's someone else. Someone whose a true believer, someone who doesn't think we all have to be like Kim Philby and Gerry Adams just to be yanks.

Feel free to join this conversation. What was it like for you when they told you the story? Were they droll, did they give you a lot of gory details, did they care how you felt about being accused of such a heinous crime?

title: Trans guy looking for humans to socialize with
text:
Hey there :) My name's Dahvie (D'awww ve)

As the post says, I need others humans to socialize with. I have one friend in my state and don't rally see her. 


A bit about me:

I'm 20 years old and transgender (ftm) already changed my legal name and pronouns. 

I'm not a fan of kids and only want to be friends with people who don't want kids and don't have them unless they're all grown up.

I'm an atheist and a furry, no it's not about sex I'm asexual (not interested in sex or any sexual contact of any kind) and having my fursuit made as I type this. 

My favorite band is blood on the dance floor. However, my music taste is all over the place. Just not a fan of screamo or metal bands. 

I have no pets and am on disability but not in a wheelchair or anything. 

Guinea pigs are my favorite animal and neon green is my favorite color. I'm also vegan. No I don't give a fuck what you eat as long as you don't be rude about the fact that I don't consume innocent animals :)

I'm not okay with smoking of any kind, not even once a week so please move on if you're a smoker and don't plan on quitting soon (it stinks and I'm allergic to smoke).

I'm 420 friendly but don't partake and I prefer that you not smoke it around me because I'm trying to find a job. 

I'm generally more comfortable with people who identify as female or other transgender people, I've had no negative experiences with biological man, ironically all my bad experiences have been with women. 

Not sure what else to put here, I'm autistic and I do not like being touched in anyway. I would like to meet other fans of Blood On The Dance Floor! that are around me, I plan on going to their concert this summer and would like someone to go with. 

It'd be cool to meet other furries too! 

You can find me on Facebook @ dahvie hammons. 

My Facebook is private and I do not post pictures of myself, so please do not ask for them. I would much rather just meet in person and let you see my face that way. I do have piercings and stretched ears. Please no one religious, sexist, homophobic or racist and no Donald Trump supporters. Someone needs to assassinate that asshat.

title: You know you're a dog person when...
text:
You Know You're a Dog Person When. . ..

• Nobody's feet are allowed on the furniture, but your dogs are welcome to sleep on any piece they choose .
• It takes an entirely separate garbage can to handle the poop.
• All kinds of things around the house are in need of repair, but if your dog needs immediate surgery and out comes the checkbook.
• You haven't had your annual check up in years, but the dogs are all medically up to date.
• You're more concerned with the dogs' needs than your own when the budget gets tight.
• You can only remember people by associating them with their dog.
• Your mom calls and asks how the granddogs are.
• Every gift you ever get has something to do with dogs.
• You rip up the carpet and lay tile to make clean up so much easier.
• Your first concern when planning a vacation is whether or not the hotel will take pets.
• You politely bow out of an important social engagement so you can attend to your dogs.
• The number one priority when buying a new house is the size and landscape of the backyard.
• The cost of boarding your furkids equals that of your entire vacation.
• Your desk proudly displays your canine family.
• All dates must pass your dog's inspection.
• The first question you ask when on a date is: "So, do you like dogs?"
• You break down and buy another pillow so you can have one to sleep on.
• More than half your grocery money goes to dog food and treats.
• You send out especially-made holiday cards that feature you and the dogs.
• Your spouse issues the ultimatum: "It's them or me!" and you have no problem pointing out the suitcase.
• Your dogs eat only the most nutritionally sound food, while your favorite meal is mac'n cheese.
• You've just spent $60 on groceries and realize none of it is for yourself.
• Your "Welcome" sign has a dog on it.
• You have a kiddy wading pool in the yard, but no small children.
• You have baby gates permanently installed at strategic places around the house, but no babies.
• Poop has become a source of conversation for you and your significant other.
• Your dog sleeps with you.
• You like people who like your dog. You despise people who don't.
• You talk about your dog the way other people talk about their kid.
• You put an extra blanket on the bed so your dog is more comfortable.

How many of these can you relate to? Anything you can add to this list?

It would be nice to have a friend who can understand and relate to life with dogs!

title: Lets trade massage
text:
Update: I've posted before, but only to have people flake out. I have no idea why it's so hard to find someone willing to give as well as get a massage. You can go second so you get the most time and a better experience if you like. It's a rainy, grey day. Let's try and have a little relaxation. Nothing more is expected.

Hello,

I'll keep this short and sweet. I doubt it will go anywhere anyway.

I am single, fit and have a nice home in Silverdale. I have a massage table and give an amazing rub! I work out regularly and also like to stay very active. 

Not only do I love to give massage, once in a while I would love to get one! I hate paying for them as I think sometimes the best are between friends who aren't watching the clock and who will listen when I give them direction on what feels good. Honestly I have had problems with both when paying.

So, we can be friends who enjoy each others company and conversation, or we can just be two people who need a nice, no pressure massage. 

Not to sound like a jerk, but I do want a massage. Not to rub on you for over an hour, hop on the table and after 5 minutes of light passes of the hands, have you say you're tired. Nor do I want to get up and have you grab my privates and think that's all I'm there for.

Don't worry if you're inexperienced or don't think you have the hand strength. I can teach you what to do and how to use your weight to do the work without hardly any stress to you at all. How do you think professionals do this all day every day?

If you are interested in this, I would love to hear from you. We can chat a bit, meet somewhere public and safe for us both and see how we click. Honestly, I would love a massage today if you're up for it!

Thanks for reading and take care,

I don't live in Seattle. I'm all the way on the other side of the country, in Richmond, VA.

But I'm looking for a friend, someone to talk with. Chatting via email/messenger/txt. Everyone I know here in RVA knows everyone else, it seems. Sometimes you need an unbiased outside opinion!

I'm an artist. I love creating things. I'm polyamorous, partnered, queer, quiet... I am a shy introvert in the "real world" but an open book when talking in written word. Also, with some level of anonymity, it's much easier to open up and chat about anything.

Tell me something interesting!

title: Let's be best friends. Right now.
text:
I'm not exactly sure what I'm looking for, and I probably won't find it by posting on Craigslist, but who knows?! If this is up, I'm still looking.

It seems so difficult building a friendship in Seattle. I have many theories on why that is, but none are relevant, at the moment. What I wish could happen was that someone could let go and instantly dive into a deep, playful, meaningful friendship. Maybe just today/tonight, maybe on-going. What I wish is that I could find THAT friend. That guy/girl friendship that isn't a FWB, but also isn't afraid to admit we are attracted to each other at times, and act on it. That guy/girl friendship that can cuddle on a couch or curl up in bed when we don't have significant others. That guy/girl friendship built on trust, communication and a tremendous amount of honesty.

I feel like it's possible. I feel like it's possible to do it instantly too, but it takes an adventurous soul that is rare. Someone who is willing to let their guard down immediately and get to know a stranger under unusual circumstances. 

I have read a few posts on here that make me believe it's possible. Possible to leave everything at the door and just... be. Possible to be fully exposed. Possible to have a friendship that isn't based on sex, but isn't sexless either. Possible to allow yourself to connect. Who wants to take a leap? Who is adventurous to just show up and pretend we've known each other for years. To immediately fall into fun, playful and honest? Cuddling on the couch? Curling up and reading? Hot showers? Movies? 

Who's in? I am. 

I don't have to see a picture right away, but I will want to see one. I will happily send one in return (after I have gotten yours). I am serious, and not looking for tons of messages back and forth. Just enough to let each other feel comfortable and know we aren't the wrong kind of crazy.

title: Wanting to meet a single female
text:
I'm in my early 40s, work in the technology sector, have a car, I don't smoke, use any drugs, although I like to drink socially. I have one grown daughter who doesn't live with me.

Who I would like to meet is a single female, that means not married, not dating, not "kind of seeing someone", SINGLE. I don't want to deal with any boyfriend or husband drama.

Non smoker (not "trying to quit"), no pot or any street drugs, and no little kids. By that I mean, old enough to do their own thing, no babysitter, they have their own life.

I'm open to many things. Farmers markets, swimming, outdoor events, taking a walk, window shopping, going out for some drinks, having dinner, and plenty more. However, I don't want to go see a movie anytime soon because the purpose of getting together is to talk and get to know each other, and a movie does not work for that.

The purpose of my writing this is to meet someone. I'm not against relationships or getting serious. I wrote it in strictly platonic because to me, the regular dating section is for those strictly wanting to meet someone for a relationship. I'm looking for a friendship. If it leads to more, that is great, but if it doesn't, I understand. I'm not going to expect sex.

Material items don't matter to me. I never liked those who have to flaunt what they have. I like down to earth, realistic people who just appreciate others and are respectful.

I am a little old fashioned. Opening doors, complimenting, being on time (not 15 minutes late and saying no big deal), buying dinner, and getting to know someone, with no expectations.

My lifestyle is a night owl. I can get up at 5 or 6 am if I have to (such as the house is on fire... well, even then I'm not sure), but by default I get up later in the morning and go to bed late. If your day ends at 6, 7, 8 pm, and you don't want to go out at all, then I'm not the right person. That doesn't mean I want to be out at 2 am, but I don't shut down at 6 pm either. There is nothing wrong with staying home to watch a movie or TV, I like that as well, I just don't want to be home every night.

Your location isn't real important (as long as your address isn't the state prison), but at least in the beginning, we need to meet half way. I'm not driving an hour to be stood up. It has happened.

I would like to meet someone who will make effort to stay in touch. Doesn't matter if we call, text, email, but I do expect effort on both sides.

Also, getting together fairly regularly matters. I'm not interested in anybody who has to pencil me in on her calendar 3 weeks from now, then once a month afterwards. No thank you.

If you like what you have read so far, please write back and tell me about yourself. That does not mean write one sentence saying "hey... what's up? wanna talk?" I delete those replies.

I can tell you much more about myself once we get to know each other. I don't hide anything and I don't lie. If I did lie, I wouldn't remember what I said, so it is just easier to be honest.

I believe in communication, honesty, trust, and integrity. If I say I will be somewhere at 5, I will be there at 5, not 5:30 with some lame excuse. If I say I will do something, I do it.

title: Married Friends
text:
I am generally a happy person. I find joys in the simple things of life. But when you are in a marriage and you lose the emotional connection things can look dismal.

But we soldier on. We do the right thing. We make decisions that is best for everybody. And in the process of it all things we need are left out. And then one day you find yourself here on craiglist looking at personal ads. Clearly something went wrong. But I am here and you are here reading this. Most of the world has even moved passed craigslist. With the birth of the app markets online dating has completely changed. But when you are married and seeking a covert emotional connection you don't want to put your picture on Tinder. Ashley Madison, data leak aside, just seems too dirty, and makes the whole thing official.

As far as I can tell Craigslist is the only place where I can post with a degree of being anonymous and find somebody with similar thoughts. But for the most part it is a barren wasteland. I might write a really clever post and only get some scammers to reply. And they are not even the good scammers! They are the brain dead obvious ones.

I am posting this as strictly platonic because that is how our relationship should start. It should start with no expectations, no guarantee of chemistry. Rather it is two people who are married and both resonated a feeling of emptiness and loneliness. From there we chat, share, and maybe even meet for lunch. Who knows how far it can go. . .or how short.

For the record I am 41, work in Bellevue, in reasonably good shape, and despite writing this ad, mostly sane. What about you?

The picture is from Crossroads mall...not too far from where I work.

I'm a nerd-inclined, open-minded, midwest-transplant hoping to make new girlfriends in the Seattle area. I like comedy, anime, cartoons, art, music, people-watching, crafts, food, video and board games. I also get really excited about anything to do with cute animals. 

I'm 420 friendly and it'd be nice if you are too for ice-breaking but that's not a requirement. I'd like to find someone who might be interested in taking a yoga class, because I'm super into yoga now, and I'd love to find people to play Magic the Gathering with as well. I'm also very interested in exploring the outdoors here and learning more about sustainable/green living.

I like being upfront and honest with people, but I also love sarcasm.

I don't understand sports, I don't like organized religion but I respect other people's choices as long as they respect mine. I care about politics (liberal/socialist, feel the Bern!). I am LGBT friendly and try to respect and understand all people :)

If any of this sounds appealing to you please respond with something interesting about yourself so we can start a dialogue. I am only interested in platonic friendships so please no creepers!!!

Also I don't have a car but I'm working on mastering public transportation!

text:
Good luck finding a more fun, interesting, open minded, easy going, creative, calmly driven, hyper-eligible and heterosexual, biped, humanoid anywhere this side of West Seattle! If you think you can, bring this alleged subject before me so I may learn his ways, or not... 
uhh... Bragging about myself is not my strong point.
Modesty is blindingly more noble than arrogance or competitiveness. 
However, I do probably need to at least explain and describe myself.
so here goes: 
I am the proud inventor of the SpiderWhistle.(c)
Spiders of every kind come 'a runnin' from all directions fast as lightning with one blow of my new and improved SpiderWhistle.(c)
IMPORTANT NOTICE: Don't forget to have plenty of SpiderChow.(c) on hand as it is NOT recommended to tease spiders. Remember that serving anything other than "SpiderChow (c)" brand Spider food may cause spiders to become aggressive toward the whistle-blower.
Children ages 3 and under "should" be supervised. 
Use caution in densely wooded, tropical areas near the equator. 
Seek medical attention immediately if / when a spider attack occurs. 

I'm a Licensed and Certified Professionalologist, but I try not to let it get to my head. 
Also a self proclaimed Intellectual Magician / Professional Musician / Freelance Comedian / Experimental Philosopher / Makeshift Psychonautical Neuropharmacologist / Perspective Expander / Love Provider & Receiver / Under-vindicated Malingerer / Emotionally Mature Subgenius / Eccentric Unobtainium Collector. 
At times I tend to become a bit compunctous in the profundity of intellectual confabulations, as my vocabulary is inexplicably breviloquent, and I have little to no comprehension whatsoever of the vast verbicullarly linguistic proclivities randomly strewn throughout the entire modern English Lexicon. In other words, I'm highly uneducated, so language is basically like, just a bunch a werds i ain evin tryin uh fill my brainz wif cuz iss too full uh poo ahready!
Oh yeah, I should probably also mention something about my "Deliberate Tourette's Syndrome" which I acquired while vacationing in Sub-Space-Zer0 via un-airborne imagi-pathogen-nation.
so, moving on...
If there's anything particular you don't enjoy about me or my ridiculous banter, PLEASE tell me, & lay it on thick too, I mean really make it sting, I can take it. lol...
Insane, how people really believe that "words can hurt". HA!
There's always room for improvement from what I've been told, but who knows... who cares, 
or not. Whuddoo eye no!
PS. Not into needing or being an emotional sponge, jealousy, control, deception, desperation, ridiculous expectation, impersonal tradition, arrogant narcissism, racism, sexism, fascism, or closed mindedness, so I guess that means I'm open to any of the above, because I'm just THAT open-minded. I'd even be down for some crazy-ass, whack'd out fetish shit that exclusively incorporated all the above, as long as we can have insane screaming arguments in public regarding the most unlikely subjects, accompanied by reverse psychology body language. 
Allow me to present a scenario;
SO FAR, THIS AD HAS ONLY ATTRACTED THE ATTENTION OF MEN, AND MEN WHO DRESS AS WOMEN, SOME VERY CONVINCINGLY, AS WELL AS STRATEGICALLY TRYING TO BAIT ME INTO HOMOSEXUAL ENCOUNTERS. I GET HIT ON BY GUYS PLENTY ON CAPITOL HILL, CAUSE I PROBABLY LOOK LIKE A BEAR, AND I FEEL FLATTERED AND HONORED AND IT'S A GREAT FEELING TO BE DESIRED, AND I WOULD TOTALLY KICKIT WITH THOSE DUDES LIKE PLATONIC STYLEE, AND BULLSHIT ABOUT BREEDERS. ALSO, I'M BEGINNING TO BELIEVE THAT ABSOLUTELY NO SINGLE CUTE FEMALES IN SEATTLE ARE WASTING TIME LOOKING FOR LOSERS ON CRAIGSLIST WHEN THEY COULD BE AT A SPORTS BAR SCORING STUD AFTER STUD. title: You smoke them, I'd like the empty packs
text:
I roll my own cigarettes and use empty king size hard packs to pack and carry my smokes, now my old packs are getting very worn!
I have acquired both the plastic and metal cigarette cases commonly sold in tobacco shops and online, but they aren't what I prefer or use. The reason is because with a cigarette hard pack I can just reach in for a smoke and lighter and light up in one easy motion. 
Those hard cases they sell involve removing the pack from my purse and digging out a cigarette... Hey, there are enough people who want to bum my wonderful rollies as it is without calling the extra attention to the fact that I've got ("free!") smokes ;) . :( Also, those manufactured cigarette boxes don't load as easily as my reused hard packs. 
So there you have my reasons...
If you or anyone you know smokes non-menthol king size hard pack cigarettes and are willing to pass the boxes along, please get in touch with me.
I am partial to Marlboro Lights, American Spirit or Camel packs, but I'm open as long as they're in good shape and not menthol! Regardless of the brand, they would need to be king size to serve my purposes.
I am willing to buy these if we can agree on a fair price.
I posted this under 'Wanted' and didn't get any response. In the spirit of posting in this platonic section I will add that if I met someone compatible who wanted to walk around the city smoking, as this weather gets nicer, I would think of that as a nice happenstance.

title: Wondering where the time has gone
text:
My chest is heavy, breathing fast, but not able to catch my breath. Thoughts swirling in my head, all lead to the same question, is this it? Sitting down on the park bench, I stare up into the cold dark sky. Slowly a new world opens up, the dust from the Milky Way starts to glow. Before long, the sharp pain in my chest eases up and the light headed feeling is gone. With my head in my hands I wonder how I got here. Is this really my life as I expected it? Wanted it? Where did the years go? Its funny to stare into such a vast space, knowing how big the universe is and yet feeling all alone, such an insignificant feeling.

What happened to the days of feeling so alive? The days when loving and being loved was all the mattered. When did it change to careers, finances and kids leaving no time to each other. I miss the passion. I miss the unconditional love, attention and affection. The spark that seemed that ignited my world and the feeling of giving myself to someone and getting them in return.

What is it that I really want? Adventure. The excitement of something new. The feeling of standing at the edge of cliff and taking that leap of faith into the waters below. I want the summer of 69, the days that have long since past and the romance that was with them. The kind of love that is intense and in the moment, even though we know it isn't meant to last. I want steamy car windows and being spontaneous. I want my heart to race every time I get a text message, call or email. I want to embrace this life once again.

What am I looking for? Someone who wants what I want. It really is that simple. Age isn't nearly as important, though it should be said you better be old enough to get into a bar, casino and or vote. Really, if you are old enough that you don't even get carded, that works for me. As for me, I grew up with the A-Team, Doogie Howser and Saved By the Bell. Please know that I'm looking for someone real. Not just real thoughts and emotions, but some kind of physical contact. Yes this is a crazy world and I am absolutely ok with being safe, taking things slow and meeting for coffee or lunch to start. It all starts with you though, all it takes is a reply.

title: Professional Cuddling Services
text:
"Your presence makes me feel like I have been transported to another place where gentleness, kindness, giggles and love are in charge. . . During yesterday's cuddle, I saw the light of heaven in your eyes and I kept feeling the touch of an Angel." --John (my first cuddle client), January 18, 2016 (following our fourth session).

ABOUT ME

I began professional cuddling in December 2015, but I have been a cuddle enthusiast for as long as I can remember. I believe consensual, non-sexual touch is profoundly powerful and essential to a happy life. Oxytocin (the hormone produced when humans touch) can decrease stress, boost the immune system, crystallize memories, and fight insomnia. Touch deprivation is detrimental to our well-being, and I want to help end it -- one cuddle at a time!

I am empathetic, nurturing, playful, expressive, and down-to-earth. People generally feel comfortable and relaxed in my presence. Given my own happiness is strongly dependent upon the happiness of others, I put forth tremendous effort into ensuring those around me are bubbling over with bliss and positive energy. I like to call that my "positive feedback loop."

CUDDLING SESSIONS

Prior to a session, I provide prospective clients with a copy of my guidelines (to outline my process, what I offer, and what I don't offer) and a brief questionnaire (to help me understand your specific wants and needs). Then we will talk via phone or Skype to go over any questions/concerns and feel out our cuddling chemistry. If both parties consent, we will move forward with booking a session!

I offer in-call sessions at my personal space in Ballard, or a therapeutic rental space in West Seattle. I'm also available for out-calls in the Seattle area for an additional travel fee. My rate is $80/hour. The length of a session can range from 1.5 to 4 hours. 

In all sessions, you will receive my undivided attention with unconditional love and acceptance. Sessions are completely customizable and based on mutual consent. You are invited to share anything with me in a completely judgement-free, confidential environment. 

To be heard, hugged and held, come cuddle with me!

title: Church Girl Years Ago
text:
I grew up in a small town and attended a Baptist Church like many other good little boys. This extraordinarily precocious girl, C. S., also attended the church. I knew her all through junior high and high school. She wore these exceedingly tight skirts, nylons, and heels, tight knit blouses too. Since our preacher had convinced us that we were going to roast in hell for our wayward thoughts, mine seemingly, inevitably, became even more stimulated, wayward, and elaborate. I still remember the parties where she wore similar things, perhaps even tighter fitting, than she wore in church. She would sit on my lap and I would rest my hand on her textured nylon legs. I suspect she knew full well what was going on beneath her.
I wish that I could go back to that time and place knowing what I know now.
Any C.S.'s out there who always wanted to make it with the smartest, most sought after, best athlete in town? who went on to the big city and to some very rewarding things but who has always had you in the back of his mind somewhere, wondering if you were feeling the same thing he was all those years? Perhaps still are? Even platonically. Then there was S. S. and K. S. too.
Appreciation and/or quid pro quo's of all sorts considered.
Take me back and forward. Hint: small logging town; G. Creek
Please: no "trade" ladies bother respond.

title: Do you have a secret crush?

Don't worry. It isn't me.

But, I want to hear about it. Do you work with him? Is he single? Are you single?

Please, dish. I love to hear about a woman's man crush. And you can ask me for advice on how to proceed. I'm just as curious if I know anything about women as perhaps you are about your crush's ability to "figure it out".

Fire away. I have the answer. Or, a answer.

title: Looking for advice, married women only
text:
Okay, it's a long shot. But it seems like it might be a place to get an honest, yet anonymous answer. 

If a married woman is about to, um, "step out" on her husband, what are the signs? I really want to know. Working long hours, declining sex life, yes, I get all that. But what is going through a woman's head exactly? Is she seeking, shopping around for another man, only after which she will then end it with her husband? Or is it just a one time thing? Seems like it could not be an on going thing, as that would be risky. Is it emotional, as in, just wants attention? Or is it sexual only? Or is it not binary at all, and a bit mixed up?

I have friends who have tried the "on the side" route over time, and they categorically always get caught. So, it doesn't seem like a women would be that clueless, as men generally are more risk takers...right?

What is the public persona? Is it on line? Is it going out for a drink after work more consistently? Business conferences? Neighbors? Where does she look and make herself available?

Research.

title: Friends only...well with some snuggling
text:
NOTE BEFORE YOU READ MY AD: MANY MEN READ THIS, ARE NOT INTERESTED, BUT FEEL THEY HAVE TO GIVE ME SEX ADVICE. DON'T BOTHER. THE PROBLEM ISN'T WHAT YOU THINK IT IS. I DON'T NEED YOUR ADVICE, YOU DON'T KNOW MORE THAN MY DOCTOR, AND I HAVE BEEN AROUND THE BLOCK. IF YOU ARE NOT INTERESTED IN A PLATONIC INTELLECTUAL RELATIONSHIP, JUST MOVE ON.

Let's face it, at our age, there are a lot of us whose body parts aren't cooperating. My knees are killing me:-( And due to a drug given to my mother during her pregnancy with me, my intimate parts don't work correctly anymore. It has stopped me from posting in the romantic section. But I miss male companionship and affection. We both just see our malfunctioning body parts as a natural part of the aging process of life instead of a loss, and neither one of us is going to let that stop us from having a close, loving, fun, long-term relationship. I'm 63 years of age, 5' 5", divorced, have waste long brown hair, a few more pounds than I would like (but not obese), very healthy (no high blood pressure, no high cholesterol, no diabetes). Things that I like to do: I love live shows of all kinds (plays, comedy, opera, concerts, restaurants with live music, etc.), science (especially archaeology, paleontology and astrophysics), museums, the beach, Sunday afternoon trips, cozy warm snuggling by the fire, cuddling while watching a movie, good wine, ethnic restaurants, National Geographic, The Big Bang Theory (the TV show) and dancing. Hoping to spend some of the winter months in Hawaii or Arizona in three years when I retire. Want to visit Egypt and Italy, and would love to explore the U.S. in an RV someday (I especially love the Southwest). I am happy, secure and independent. I love going out with my friends and won't give that up, but miss the companionship and affection of a man. Most importantly, we both love to laugh! If you think you want to try to make me laugh, tell me something about yourself and SEND ME A PHOTO (most of you seem to miss this request). I will send you a photo and more about myself, if I think there will be a connection. PLEASE, NO MARRIED MEN (most of you seem to miss this request) no drug addicts, no alcoholics, no gamblers, no STDs (you may think this is a strange request if there is not going to be sex, but I have reasons), no smoking, and have employment or a secure retirement. PLEASE live within 30 minutes of Lynnwood and be between 59 and 68. Oh so, you think I am very picky for someone looking for a friend. But the fact is that I have plenty of friends and I like my life, so I am just looking for the RIGHT someone who will make it a little better. If you are not within my requested age range or distance, please don't bother me.

title: Will you be my tour guide/companion?
text:
Professional male coming to Seattle on Friday 4/22 for a work trip, but I'm coming early to walk around the city and explore. I'd love a travel companion for the weekend. I like to walk and explore, regardless of the weather. We can grab a craft beer in a pub for lunch, see the sights (maybe take a ferry across the sound to explore outside of the city) and then have a cocktail before a good dinner with a nice red wine. I like to watch people (serious amateur photographer), I like to see the places tourists don't see and I like to learn about the history of a place. Throughout the day, I will tell you absolutely anything you want to know about me. I will answer every question you put to me. I hope you'll share with me as well. There is nothing that helps people become instantly intimate than the anonymity of not knowing each other and knowing that we will soon part ways; it gives you freedom to say anything. I tend to click best with women in their 30's who have a liberal arts type of education or something in the social sciences area, though scientists and engineers are also fascinating, as is a barista who gets to watch people all day. Just be interesting and not bitter; who has time for that?!? For our little adventure, I will pay for everything, period. 

A little more about me: I'm a white male, professional with a grad degree. I am a consultant with a unique niche, which we can talk about later. I travel a fair bit. I'm in my late 40's, 6'2" and tend toward the beefy side. I'm married and have kids. Again, there's a story there (isn't there always?!?). People tell me that I'm kind, I have a n air of confidence but not cockiness and I can be amusing. I also listen well and can talk with you for hours. I was in the navy as an officer and that helped me to see the world (yes, the cliche is true). I've been to Europe, Central America, the Mideast and SE Asia. The world gets more amazing the more you see of it...

So,. what do you think? Interested? If so, shoot me an email with a photo and ask me anything. I'll return a note to you with a few photos of me.

title: Thursday: Dinner & A Show: Singing in the Rain
text:
THURSDAY, I would like to treat a young lady to a show and dinner (either order). 

I'm 59 yo so to "Singing in the Rain" starts tomorrow at the Seattle Center, 8:00 PM. No obligations. Singin' in the Rain: Classic Musical Makes a Splash The Cornish Playhouse at Seattle Center, Former Intiman Theatre, Seattle Center Campus, Northwest Corner ( 201 Mercer Street Seattle, WA 98109 ) 
In one of film's most iconic scenes, Gene Kelly famously partnered with an umbrella and tap danced through puddles in Singin' in the Rain. Now all the unforgettable songs and dances -- including the show-stopping title number -- have been lovingly adapted for the stage by Broadway legends Betty Comden and Adolph Green. Presented at The Cornish Playhouse at Seattle Center, the show's set in the days just after the success of the first talkies, when studio execs find themselves scrambling to salvage the career of Lina Lamont, a silent picture star with an iron-clad contract ... and a voice like a screech monkey. They decide to hire an aspiring actress to overdub Lina's voice -- but when the leading man falls in love with the voice-over girl, and the audience clamors for Lina to sing live, there's plenty of hilarious trouble afoot!

title: IT'S SPRING! Let's get out of the city!
text:
Now that we have nicer weather and more daylight, I'm looking for some people to join me in the great outdoors. Day hikes, snowshoeing, ski touring, mountaineering, backpacking, etc. I love to reach the quiet, pristine wilderness, which sometimes just requires a meandering walk along nice trails, and other times takes 2-3 hours of driving followed by 15, 20, even 25 miles of steep hiking over rough terrain. I don't go anywhere dangerous or extreme though, partly because I'm usually carting a bunch of camera gear! 

So I'm looking for people who are in pretty good shape for those longer trips, but are also fine with the simpler outings. And you'll have to put up with me stopping occasionally to set up a tripod and take lots of pictures. But hey, I have a high-clearance SUV that I can drive, and I'll offer to plan everything, so you shouldn't complain ;) Or if you want to take the lead planning and/or driving, that's fine too! 

You should live near Seattle so we can easily meet for our trips, and we'd probably be able to relate better if you're somewhere around my age, say no more than 10-15 years apart. Other than that, just have a personality that's fun to be around :)
dislikes: Those big boxy things all around me
interests: Those big pointy things on the horizon

title: New Mates!
text:
Greetings, G'day

Aussie Frenchy here in the PNW just looking for a new mate. Hoping to meet someone for all sorts of endeavours, someone to text/chat and later hang about with. Close friends are far away and the loneliness is a bit of a drag. I miss my mate mates, just chatting about the day, going on errands, gaming, driving etc. I'd want to I could meet new folks out and about but lately it's been pretty difficult for some reason. What the hell is it with people being so into themselves ey? Maybe it's just be but that is what I see. So I thought that I would give this a go even though I've tried making mates thru digital means only to end in weird failure. Flaky folks seemed to be the theme of the people I've chatted with. Right then, well I'm pansexual, a good mate who believes friendship is something to cherish. In fact real friendship is bloody marvelous. I'm happy yet sad, you wouldn't know when the sad is about so don't worry if you think I'm a downer as I'm not. Rebel yet mellow, dark with light. I'm 28, athletic, sporting piercings, ink, and the attire ranges. I could be wearing a sport jacket with jeans or cargos, DCs, t and a hoodie (the norm for me). I travel heaps with a broad range of interests as well. As before I listed heaps of them here but now I will only name a few. Hiking, travel, listening to music (everything almost, from jazz and classical to the 70s, 80s and 90s punk. World tunes to electronica, indie, alternative, classic and modern rock etc etc blah blah) and creating it (love mixing eletronica and absolutely hate calling is EDM). I create electronica and love playing me didge, and piano. Vehicle related things as I'm a petrol head, being nostalgic, sitting on roofs, looking for E.T.s, chatting on about space, snow/skateboarding, reading, filming and photographing the world, helping folks and driving around listening to indie and going into your own world. Been a night owl lately so it can be a bit lonely. I'm looking for a good friend, easy as that, proud as punch. Not a friend on short term basis either. A friend for the ages. A GOOD MATE. Can't be to difficult to find that? I dunno perhaps it can.... Age range of friends is a pretty broad one. I know good people that I'm proud as punch to call mates ranging from 18 to 80s. If you're looking for a good friend as well, sit on a roof somewhere and just look at the view, talk and be proper mates, then please, send me a reply. I PREFER to chat thru kik, whatsapp, text or actual phone conversation. A few initial emails are OK however it seems that there are way too many flakes and bots thru email. Take care,
Ta!

title: Friend(s) available during the day?
text:
I'm a housewife (no kids, 3 cats, 2 fish, 1 husband) and while I can't say I'm ever bored during the day, it would be nice to have some female companionship sometimes. I'm not very good at saying, "hey, let's ____" so my potential friendships tend to die on the vine. I need someone who is good at making suggestions and thinking of things to do. Even if it's just sitting on the couch and crafting or staying home and baking or watching a movie. 

My hobbies are: crafting (mostly knit/crochet but I like all kinds of crafting - teach me something new!), gardening, shopping, I love road trips, eating at new places (though I'm a bit of a picky eater,) and trying new things. If you have a hobby that I haven't experienced, I'd love to try it! I'd especially love to try new things that get me outside more, but they have to be low impact and not hard on a troublesome hip. I would especially enjoy things in or on the water, or on horseback (but I don't have a horse.) But I'm game to try just about anything as long as it's legal(ish) and doesn't hurt.

My requirements for a friend aren't many. I don't really care about your age. You could be young enough to be my daughter and we'd have that kind of relationship. Or old enough to be my mother and yay for that. Or close to my age. You could have kids or not (just no unruly kids if they're going to spend much time with us, cuz... can I hit them? LOL) No smoking around me. I don't care your religion or political beliefs, in fact, I don't want to hear about them. Race is unimportant, sexual orientation is unimportant (just don't come on to me!) I'm not a fan of dogs, so if you have them I prefer they stay away from me. Across the room is fine, just don't jump on me, lick me, etc. Kitties on the other hand, should always be on me. :D If you're easily offended, move along because I'm easily offensive. 

If you're a man and think we'd make great friends, good luck with that. My husband is my best friend and he says I'm not allowed to date. 

I'm mostly looking for daytime weekday availability, but my husband is oncall every 3rd week (at least right now), and on his oncall weeks I'd be willing to leave him at home while I go do fun things without him. 

So tell me about you?

text:
I'm not sure if this is the right place to find what I'm looking for, however nothing ventured...nothing gained. Right?

Since moving to Seattle several years ago I still haven't found anyone whom I consider a true friend. I've made loads of acquaintances, and I have more than my share of fair weather friends but what I'm looking for is a REAL friend. I travel a lot for both work and pleasure and I'm looking for someone with a sense of adventure.

title: Seeking 55+ friends closer to home - w4w or w4m
text:
I'd like to meet good people who live in Renton, south Seattle, Factoria, Newcastle, Kent and other areas within about a 15-mi. radius of Renton who are ~55 and up in age. Please be a reliable person who follows through after emailing, not so busy that you never can find time to socialize, and someone who plans to remain in the area. Thank you for reading the entire ad before replying to it with answers to the PLEASE NOTE paragraph below.

Are you looking for real, long-term, reliable friends rather than just acquaintances? I'm also ready to meet new friends closer to home who are kind and considerate to share good conversation and activities. How about you? Do you love nature and getting out into it? Art and music? Let's meet at a cafe for a conversation or get out for a park walk and chat on a good weather day and go from there.

People who are adventurous, will try new things and are curious about life in general are my favorite types of friends. My interests include almost anything that's outdoors in decent weather - good walks and hikes; having a good conversation; musical events; good movies, plants/gardening and public gardens; little road trips, and lifelong learning about all types of things including other cultures. Indoor pursuits like conversation over coffee, museums, dinner, talks, hearing music of many types and the like are great when the weather may not be cooperative. I'm hoping you share some of those interests and also want to meet someone who will share some of your unique interests and offers mutual support. I'm a non-smoker (you too, please) and occasionally have a wine or drink. We don't need any of this to have a good time, however. 

I'm a truly good person, have a sense of humor, and am a good friend who remembers birthdays, pays attention to what friends say, and tells them about news or activities I think will interest them. I'm also an empathetic person who will help friends in whatever way I can whenever I can. I'm intelligent, but not intellectual, have a spiritual side but am not religious. (No proselytizers, please) I'm reliable and look for other people who are too, as well as people who are kind, good people who have most of those qualities. Nobody is perfect, of course.

PLEASE NOTE: Please email and include where you are (city/neighborhood), a bit about your personality and interests, and days/time windows you're generally available to socialize. Please be close to the boomer age range and in the areas posted in the first paragraph above. If you'd like to send along your number in addition to a self-description to shortcut things, you can definitely trust me with it. 

If you're fit enough to get out for at least brisk walks, that would be great. I'm fairly fit for this age. I was born elsewhere, have been in the Northwest more than half a lifetime and have interest in meeting people from everywhere. If you're overly concerned with superficiality over substance, we very likely would not be compatible. Otherwise, I look forward to hearing from you soon! [Sorry, not looking to meet married people or couples. It doesn't generally work out that well.]

title: Photographer seeks Muse ...
text:
I placed this ad originally under Gigs/Talent, but because I'm not necessarily seeking an experienced model, I thought I'd also try here in SP:


HI,

I'm an experienced, well equipped photographer seeking an ongoing subject for lifestyle shoots.

I have a strong background in landscape and seascape. I've become strong at headshot portraits. I'm still working at developing my eye for lifestyle and environmental.

I'm looking for someone that genuinely enjoys being photographed and who wants to work together now and then in an ongoing arrangement of TFP. You'd get a lot of high-res, edited images with no rights restrictions; use them however you wish.

I need your time, energy and creative input.

With this being CL, I feel like I need to add that I do not shoot nudes or erotic. I am not ever interested in seeing you naked. I don't want to date you or hookup with you. 

This is a legitimate and honest attempt to find someone who enjoys being photographed, as much as I enjoy shooting and editing.

Ongoing is the key. I'd really like to find someone I can work and improve with longer term. I'm looking to develop that rapport that leads to much greater connection between camera and subject.

Lastly, this is not fashion modeling. You don't need to be perfect or any particular height/shape/shade. This is portrait work ... all sorts of looks and types can work for this.


The sample images are my work, shared with permission of the subjects.


Keywords: model, photographer, portrait, photoshoot, portfolio, TFP

title: A free massage - is it a Taboo on here?
text:
One request: Please don't flag:)

So, I have posted couple of times on CL offering a free massage.

I used to do this quite a bit earlier in another city (moved here 4 yrs ago) and I would easily find folks to trade massages with. If nothing, it'd be at least a one way massage. 

It was so strange - for both my ads, I got like one response...lol. 

Thought - I was doing something wrong so thought of seeking feedback. What would be a concern seeking a platonic massage through CL? 

I mean, Massages are fairly expensive so a free one should be interesting, right? As for safety, I first offer to meet in public, talk on phone and even keep the first massage as simple as possible - for example just arms or just neck. No full body or anything that'd make you uncomfortable with a stranger. I can also offer couple of references from my friends in NYC who I have done this with. Not once have I crossed the decency line. I'm a gentleman with a normal life, job, education etc. High hygiene and to those it matters, I look decent too.

Why I do it - its fun really. Meeting someone new and the possibility of finding a massage trading partner is awesome. I enjoy the touch - giving or receiving but have zero expectations beyond that. Relaxation and the chat and the idea of meeting someone new is just awesome!

Overall, its full transparency so wanted to know what could I still be missing in my offer?

Any and every feedback is welcome - feel free to just curse me too:) Even that is a feedback!

title: What's up with all the big women on craigslist
text:
I've been posting on here for some time now, and most of the women that reply are big''
+ sized'', or just all around ugly'', I don't know what the deal is up here in the northwest,
what are all the women doing, sitting around and eating all day, or what''.
I post something on here, and 90% of the women that send me a pic are big.
I just don't get it, is craigslist the place for big women to hang out or what.
Now wen ever I do meet a nice looking woman on here, and I send my pic back,
I never hear from them anymore, so I must be ugly too.
It's just funny how ugly doesn't like ugly'',
I look for women that are more on the pleasant looking side,
I also in joy talking to younger women too, but there must be something about my age.
I don't think I'm old be any means, but the younger women don't want anything to do with me.
O'', by the way, I'm only looking for friends, low drama, pleasant looking, a little extra pounds is ok,
just don't be BBW'', I can click with big women, I just don't want to be friends with them.
I don't know why I feel that way, it's just how I feel, sorry to all the big people out there .
But at the same time I've been told I go after homely women, and just pleasant looking people,
and why don't I just try a little harder for a good looking women,
I don't know why, I just like pleasant looking people''
So that's my post for today, I'm not trying to piss anyone off, I'm just pointing out my feelings.

title: Wanting to meet a single female
text:
I'm in my early 40s, work in the technology sector, have a car, I don't smoke, use any drugs, although I like to drink socially. I have one grown daughter who doesn't live with me.

I would like to meet a single female, that means not married, not dating. I don't want the drama of a jealous boyfriend/husband.

Non smoker, no pot or any street drugs, and no little kids. By that I mean, old enough to do their own thing, no babysitter, they have their own life.

I'm open to many things. Farmers markets, swimming, outdoor events, taking a walk, window shopping, going out for some drinks, having dinner, and plenty more. However, I don't want to go see a movie anytime soon because the purpose of getting together is to talk and get to know each other, and a movie does not work for that.

Someone who is available fairly regularly. Not necessarily daily, but at least once a week or two.

Not looking for sex or one night stands. If you are, or are into that, please don't reply.

This purpose of this ad isn't to find a relationship, rather someone to spend time with. I'm not against relationships at all, and I would like to have one at some point, but that is not my goal right now.

Material items don't matter to me. I never liked those who have to flaunt what they have. I like down to earth, realistic people who just appreciate others and are respectful.

I would like to meet someone who will make effort to stay in touch. Doesn't matter if we call, text, email, but I do expect effort on both sides.

If you like what you have read so far, please write back and tell me about yourself. One sentence, quick replies like "hey how are you? let's talk" are deleted. No effort was made.

title: Seeking a friend for the end of the world :-)
text:
Hello, thanks for stopping by. I'm a 46 yr old male looking for a female friendship, I don't care if you're single or married, skinny, thick, bbw, white, black, purple, alien or other. What I care about is personality.

Do you have a sense of humor, can you take a ribbing as well as give one? Are you open minded? Do you look at things and try to see the best?

I'm married and I've been with the same woman for the last 12 years. I'm not looking to change that, as I love her deeply, but the passion is gone, the dog gets more attention than I do. I miss that spark, that feeling when you look into each others eyes and the butterflies.

I want to start losing weight again and getting back into shape. I started a couple of years ago and was doing well, but after a knee injury, I slid back the other way. I live near Silver Lake and I've been thinking it would be nice to start walking around the lake again several times a week or even daily. It would be nice to have a companion to accompany me and perhaps we can get in shape together. It would also be nice to hang out once in awhile and watch a movie or just sit and talk. I'm currently self-employed and I'm flexible in my schedule, but most often have free time during the weekdays from 9:30 to 3:00 and occasionally on weekends.

I'd like a friendship where she understands my situation, perhaps is in the same. Someone who isn't looking to change my situation or me hers. If more develops beyond just friends, I'm not opposed, but I'm also not expecting. Friendship is really the more important factor, anything else is icing. I tried this several months back and met a couple of nice people, but one had opposing schedules, one got close to me and then apparently got old feet and suddenly disappeared and one, who I thought was great after awhile admitted she didn't like kids and my son is everything to me. So no luck before, I'm trying once again as it's getting nice outside. 

So if you've made it this far, why not say hello. Perhaps we can chat a bit by email or kik and go from there. Please don't ask for a picture unless you're willing to send one as well, as I said personality is more important to me than looks. One can be a model, but if their personality sucks, they're going to be ugly in my eyes.

I'm getting a lot of spam/scam, so please change the subject to Cultured Pearl, so I know it's a genuine response. Hope to hear from you soon.

title: Why solo ski-mountaineer/ski Mt Baker, Whistler & Mt Rainier ...
text:
... if there is an alternative of sharing it with someone special
First schedule (approx), than some personal/logistics & finally the point:
1) I'll be in Portland Apr18-21, around Seattle Apr21-22, Mt Baker Apr22-24 (from Schreibers Meadow TH), ski Whistler Apr25-27 (3days) & eastern WA Apr28-30 & Mt Rainier May01-04 (from Paradise)
2) I'm in my early 50s (love it), well educated & successful (plenty luck), enjoy sports & outdoors (rather fit) and have no time for drama. I'm looking for fun companionship with shared responsibilities ... we are in it together. You can join here or there for a day or whatever else works out for us. The schedule isn't necessarily set in concrete and have no place in Whistler yet (happy to homesit or take care of things as needed). I'm not guiding anything (even though I could!?) and above average fitness level and skills in ski-moutainieering/skiing might be beneficial. That said, I'll compromise somewhat to make things work out OK ... that's the goal.
3) In case you are interested but wondering: yes, I have the best wife there is and she actually suggested that I might have more fun with a companion than on my own. She is unavailable and knows that I love sharing good times with someone who treasures the moment and the now as much as I do ... that said and with the obvious that good sex is great, that is not even near the top of the list of "action" I'm looking for. Let's enjoy the magnificent outdoors and maybe have some fun conversation for a drink (i.e., apres ski) ... BTW, aside from sports I enjoy science, aviation, travels, cultures, cuisines, etc. just to mention a few.
If you are interested, please share a little about yourself and why, when, how, etc. you might be able to join and provide at least a first name, picture and phone number. I'll return the favor and we can take it from there .... Berg Heil

title: Fun, funny, interesting people? Text and Email - Friends Only!
text:
Hi! 

I have actually reached out a few times with no real success. So, here goes. 

I don't think CL is a good medium for starting conversation with someone, but maybe you could prove me wrong. 

Before you spend too much time reading my post - let me tell you why you may NOT be interested. 

1. I have a boyfriend. 
- This means I won't be able to meet up or call you, just email and text only. 
2. I don't want to give out my picture! 
- I want to just talk to someone and since we may never meet, it shouldn't be that big of a deal what I look like. Maybe you will eventually coax me into sending you one, but it definitely won't be right up front. I left a general description below. If you absolutely must have attractive texting friends, you probably shouldn't message me. 
3. I work 8-5, M-F. 
- I don't have the luxury of texting all day while I'm at work, but after work and during lunch I'm usually available. Sometimes delayed. 

So, if you are still reading, here is why you SHOULD message me:

1. I don't care how old or young you are. 
- If you are fun to talk to, and we can relate on at least some points, and can be respectful of each other's differences, I don't care much about your age. 
2. I don't care how black or white or Hispanic or any-race you are. 
- See #1.
3. I don't care how married or single or divorced or separated or "complicated" you are. 
- As long as your significant other, if you have one, either knows what you are doing, won't find out what you are doing, or won't care if they did find out. I don't want to cause any relationship issues. 
4. I'm not easily offended by most topics. 
- "Most". 
5. I don't mind a bit of perviness or sarcasm. 
- As long as you aren't a total jerk, or making the conversation entirely sexual, or trying to ultimately get me to sext with you, I generally won't mind. 
6. I am naturally quite curious. 
- Even if I know nothing about the things you are interested in, I will have questions (provided you don't mind answering). 

If you're still here, this is what I want from you:

1. Be fun. 
- I don't mind at all if you have problems, I'm more than willing to listen and be a friend from the get go. But I deal with depression myself so I have to be careful too. If you have social anxiety or are socially awkward though, I would be very interested to talk about it and learn more about you. 
2. Be interesting. 
- You don't have to lead an interesting life to be an interesting person. Just have some thoughts in your head! 
3. Be at least somewhat intelligent. 
- See #2. I don't care if you are well educated or not, as long as you have some thoughts in your head to share. 
4. Be able to carry on a conversation! 
- This! Please limit your one word responses. If you are busy, fine. Sometimes I can only get out one or two words myself. But generally, I like to just talk back and forth. Maybe I don't ask you about yourself, but you just tell me things about you. I will tell you things about me, too. Too much Q&A gets boring and unoriginal. I want to hear your thoughts, your stories, your perspective on life. Tell me something deep, or something really silly. I like both, so ideally you will be serious sometimes and silly other times. But, even my seriousness is usually laced with a touch of humor. 

Here is the final thing you should know about me, if you have made it all this way. Real friendships CAN be made via chats and emails. I have friends who I have "known" for over 15 years, that I have only ever chatted with, and I have made real life friends who started as mere chatting. I would love to make a REAL friend, who I could talk to about work, or listen to about their day. We could exchange relationship stories, life experiences, dreams, goals, anything! Once life becomes a routine, it gets unexciting and predictable. You don't have to be exciting, just be willing to share interesting details and mundane ones alike. 

What did you have for dinner? What did you hope to become when you were younger? What did that customer do to you recently that really made your day notable? What interests you most about your significant other - or generally about women if you are single? Have an embarrassing story? Did something happen when you were young that shaped your life as you grew up? 

If you have made it this far, you really need to message me. 

Email is fine, at least starting out, but alternatively I have Kik, WhatsApp, and regular texting. Sort of prefer Kik or WhatsApp but I will do whatever. 

Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: In need of housing...soon!
text: Hello, Everyone...We are a middle-aged (51 & 55), long-term (22 years) gay couple who, like so many other people, are in a middle-age crisis. I am/have been steadily employed for years, but my partner is currently having employment troubles. He is working part-time (making more per hour than I do full-time) but not in his field of expertise. Unfortunately, we have to short-sell our dream home of 10 years in Kingston because of this. We need a solution, quickly. I believe we have about 120 days before we must leave this home. We have two dogs (one three years old, one 11 years old), both weighing in the 50-60lb range. They are lovers, but can bark at strangers, like any faithful companion. Ideally, we would like to find a small home/cottage/cabin/in-law/guest house/mobile/manufactured (1 bed/bath) with small fenced yard for the "kids" in the North or Central Kitsap area. Second choice, would be an apt allowing pets our size or a shared home situation. Maybe even another gay couple looking to ease their expenses? We are a quiet family, love to cook and bake. I've been trying to save money to get a "cottage food" license but that is on-hold for now, responsible and dependable. We have two vehicles but no payments. We are conservative with utilities, willing to help with yard work, etc. We can afford up to $1000/month out of my salary. I am employed at the Oak Table CafĂŠ in Silverdale (formerly in Kingston). This is a legitimate call for help for good people who are in desperate need. Not as desperate as some, but...it's so scary to be this age and in this situation. Even if you personally don't have something to rent or are looking to reduce your expenses in a shared house situation, maybe you know someone who is open to the idea. Thank you for your time.

title: A sounding board/ new perspective
text:
The closest approximation to what I am seeking would be someone willing to share and process thoughts with me. The average persom has hundreds, if not thousands of thoughts a day, and many of them are mundane or routine, but every once in a while an idea or realization pops up that you take the time and think through but would love another perspective on it, to further round out your thoughts... but then everyone around you is so caught up in life, facebook, twitter, or even worse simply lacking the intellectual framework to understand.

If you've started sharing thoughts important to you, had your counterpart's eyes gloss over or immediately follow your thought with irrefutable proof of their complete lack of understanding, then you, too, understand how frustrating it is.

So in short, I am seeking a thought partner. 
My requirements are as follows:

- A modicum of ambition
- a desire to learn/an open mind
- an above average usage of intelligence, (We all know people with intelligence who fail to utilize it)
- A degree of mastery over the english language sufficient to communicate thoughts effectively
- Time and willingness to communicate (because talking once a month just isn't enough)

I hope to grow from knowing you and to facilitate your growth in return. I do not view age or any other demographic as a limiting factor for mental acuity.

I am not in the area, but that should not be a major factor in what i seek. Thank you. Hope to hear from you soon.

title: Needing a friend
text:
Life has been crazy for me. I spent the last decade treading water in the most uncomfortable lake amidst a brutal and unrelenting storm. Much of it was my own undoing, I'll admit.
Eventually I learned a bit about swimming, and managed to work my way to shore. The clouds are clearing now, and as the sun beats down upon my battered body, I look around and notice so much has changed. The people I knew have come and gone, their memories cutting deeper than any blade. I'm haunted, not only by my regret, but by the hollowness that's become my soul.

Things are different, now. A new place, a new start. Yet the tragic loneliness is enough to choke out even the toughest of humans. Although I appreciate solitude and shy away from most human contact, I still crave compatible companionship. So if anything you see here intrigues you, please, drop me a line.

I'm a tall, average human with a passion for animals, music, travel and writing. And although I can be considered eccentric and humorous, I'm an outstandingly sensitive and compassionate hopeless romantic.

I'm seeking anyone willing to chat and talk about anything deeply intellectual or rediculously silly. I'm looking to make a decent friend out here since I don't know many people outside my job, which I've just recently started. I don't care what you look like, what age you are, if you're fat, thin, round or square. All I ask is that you be as openminded and curious as me. 
Shoot me an email with your favorite animal as the subject.
Have a fantastic Sunday.
