title: Bongo Drums
text:
Intelligent, educated, professional, WM with a truly wicked sense of humor and a flair for the erotic, seeks an e-buddy to build synergy and to resonate with.

I get bored as hell at work because I do the same thing over and over. Sometimes the only thing that keeps me out of the loony bin is chatting it up...texting, email, IM, talking on the phone...Hell it could be smoke signals (no, not THAT kind of smoke), carrier pigeons, or bongo drums and I'd still enjoy it. 

What I'm looking for is to make a connection...To have that spark happen when intelligent conversation and flirting are mixed together with the rush of meeting somebody new. BOOM! Explosive?...Oh hell yes! I love it!

So then what happens, you ask. Well, I'm separated and I'm definitely not looking to change anybody's situation while I figure out mine. I'm really not expecting that we hook up, date, or even meet for an ice cream sundae at a church social (I've never done it in a church, lol...Have you?). At the end of the day, I'm just hoping to find a gal pal who both enjoys some male attention and giving a guy that same attention. Anything beyond that...let's cross that bridge if we ever get to it.

So let's talk about you: A woman (sorry guys, nothing personal, I just don't swing that way), 40-60 (the age is just a suggestion because we're likely to have more in common...but if you're under 40 or over 60 and you think you're up for the challenge, then by all means). Race, looks, religion, occupation, politics, astrological sign, blood type, favorite football team, etc etc are unimportant. Marital status...that's an interesting one. I prefer you to be married or divorced...But, as with the age, if you think you're up for it, then by all means. 

Turn On's:
A.) A woman who has a sense of humor as warped and irreverent as mine (You can laugh at almost anything). 

B.) A woman who doesn't need me to carry the conversation all the time (aka isn't afraid to speak her mind). 

C.) A woman with something going on upstairs (aka you know what synergy and resonance mean...or at least you're motivated enough to crack the dictionary).

D.) You're a fan of flirting and being flirted with. If you DON'T, let's not waste each others time.

Turn Off's:
A:) If you're somebody who thinks that bored people are boring, then carry your ass, sister. You're probably a princess and I don't need the headache.

B.) Likewise if you're going to be offended by my self confidence and think it's arrogance or conceit. If that's offensive or threatening, keep moving. There's plenty of gals who like self confidence in a man.

C.) Ditto on preaching about morality. If I want a lecture, I'll go to the aforementioned church and try that ice cream sundae.

D.) Nit Pickers. See A, Princess types for details. I'm not here to try and fix what's wrong with anybody and I sure don't need somebody doing it to me.

The rest of you gals, crack that dictionary, look up synergy, and drop me a line ;)

title: I want go get off my ass this summer
text:
Just like the title says, I don't want to spend another summer sulking in my apartment because I don't have any friends to do things with. 

About me:
Transgender ftm
Male
20 
No kids (don't care for them)
Non smoker
No drugs but I'm 420 friendly I just don't use
Rides the bus everywhere
Vegan
Rodent lover
Virgo
Asexual

Since I take the bus everywhere, I'm not able to get to as many places as I would like. But, I would really like to just go out and do fun things this summer with someone. Not looking for any type of romantic relationship or sex. Just a strictly platonic relationship and if that develops into something more then we will cross that bridge when we come to it. 

I am disabled but I am completely ambulatory I don't have trouble walking. I like nature, going swimming and horses. Being vegan, I don't ride horses but I love just being around them and enjoying their company. 

I would love to go swimming at the beach or a lake in the evenings of summer, maybe even go picking berries or exploring, or just sit at home and do crafty things. I'm not an extremely crafty person but I think it would be fun to learn. 

I am not much of a kid person, but I would be able to tolerate it if you have teenagers. Age doesn't matter as long as you are a person who goes through with what you say and doesn't flake at the last minute. 

I am also autistic and I do not like physically being touched, it's nothing against the person I have sensory issues and being touched even a handshake can make me uncomfortable. I am not able to be around people who smoke, so please if you are a smoker then MoveOn. 

I love cleaning and organizing and I love love love rodents. I know most people don't like them but they are very sweet and clean. I also love all animals including dogs and cats and horses and cows. 

I'm on Social Security so unfortunately I do not have very much money to spare. I will be going through a pretty massive surgery potentially in July or August, so after that I may not be able to do as much. 

I'm just tired of spending every summer depressed in my apartment or my room like I have done since I was 11 because I didn't have any friends. I have friends but they are not in Washington. The one friend I do have who is near me cannot go swimming or hiking or walking or berry picking because she has trouble walking, so I cannot do very much with her. 

Please no overly religious people. I don't care if you are religious but let's just not talk about it because I'm an atheist and religion tends to cause unnecessary arguments. Trump supporters need not reply to this ad.

title: Perchance you happen upon this in the winds
text:
Long have I been searching for you,
Long have you been searching for me,
As we wade blindly through the weary fog,
We become lost within a cycle that entraps us.
Through the monotony of daily life I trudge,
Through the monotony of daily life you trudge,
Until the mundane becomes second hand,
And fills each inspiration we take,
As it leeches out what inspires us to feel.
We have progressed greatly with our technology,
Yet we have regressed greatly with our humanity.
A click, a tap, a touch, 
And we're connected to the whole world,
Yet in our own world, we are disconnected,
The only thing that touches us is our solitude.
A few swigs here, a few puffs there,
Only suffice temporarily.
We become artists, we create.
And in the chaos of creation and entropy,
Something organized develops,
Something that inspires others, 
To make them feel again,
To make us feel again,
It connects us.
I've been chasing an idea of you,
You've been chasing an idea of me,
An ideal marathon with destination unknown.
Perhaps I should stop chasing, and let the idea of you go,
Perhaps you should stop chasing, and let the idea of me go,
The ideas fade away,
And reality becomes us, 
And we see what's right in front of our lives,
And we live.

Hello friends, if you like what you've read and you want to share your life, I'd love to hear from you. I release this message to the winds perchance it resonates with those who happen upon it. There's so much more spirit to life than what we've been programmed to think. Let's inspire one another.

title: Healthy Eyes Looking for Healthy Girl
text:
Hello, thanks for taking the time to check out my post. 

First, I try to be a gentlemen, treating all others well despite how they treat me. I am one who thinks women ought to be cherished. On a more worldly note, most girls have thought me quite attractive (at which point I usually mark them as slightly delusional or at least in need of a visit to the Optometrist). :P (yes, that is really me in the image, taken last Summer. No, I have not gained 90 pounds since then). :)

Most people (including myself, yes!) would say I have a great sense of humor and am quite witty. Regarding physical attributes, I am tall, have dark/golden blond(ish) hair (all my own :P), blue eyes, and I am told....dimples. What type of girl am I looking for? Open to many, but I want a girl who would make a great example to her children...Staying fit, self-control (not a glutton or very overweight), and, more importantly, setting a great example by the way she lives: the things she says and does. If you do choose to reply? A photo or two would be much appreciated, but I can understand if you wish to wait. *Location isn't a big deal. I am very flexible and can work from most anywhere.

I am very athletic. I enjoy sports and walks, jogs, and runs out amidst the beauty in the world we have been given. Are you looking for someone to visit the tulip fields with? I'd love it. Are you looking for someone to go on a picnic in the mountains with? I'd love it. To go for a walk beneath a moonlit sky, find a patch of soft green grass to lie down upon, and just relax and look up at the stars and listen to the sound of waves as they caress the shore? I'd love it. I am looking for a girl who appreciates these same sorts of things, the simple yet magical gifts that many people take for granted. I am a man of my word, and expect others to be the same whether the matter be very important or seemingly insignificant.

I seek to encourage healthy behavior and discourage unhealthy. It is a shame how much unhealthy behavior in our world today is not simply ignored or unspoken of but, in fact, is actually encouraged. 

There, a little easy stuff...a little of the more sober...and that's that. Hope to hear from you soon. I also have a few chat apps for those of you who prefer it to email (which includes myself). For now I am not interested in phone calls. so, just low key to begin with...if we hit it off and want to meet for a walk and a talk later? Wonderful. 

Whatever you choose, I hope you have a wonderful evening!

title: Warped, Wicked, & Irreverent
text:
Intelligent, educated, professional, WM with a truly wicked sense of humor and a flair for the erotic, seeks an e-buddy to build synergy and to resonate with.

I get bored as hell at work because I do the same thing over and over. Sometimes the only thing that keeps me out of the loony bin is chatting it up...texting, email, IM, talking on the phone...Hell it could be smoke signals (no, not THAT kind of smoke), carrier pigeons, or bongo drums and I'd still enjoy it.

What I'm looking for is to make a connection...To have that spark happen when intelligent conversation and flirting are mixed together with the rush of meeting somebody new. BOOM! Explosive?...Oh hell yes! I love it!

So then what happens, you ask. Well, I'm separated and I'm definitely not looking to change anybody's situation while I figure out mine. I'm really not expecting that we hook up, date, or even meet for an ice cream sundae at a church social (I've never done it in a church, lol...Have you?). At the end of the day, I'm just hoping to find a gal pal who both enjoys some male attention and giving a guy that same attention. Anything beyond that...let's cross that bridge if we ever get to it.

So let's talk about you: A woman (sorry guys, nothing personal, I just don't swing that way), 40-60 (the age is just a suggestion because we're likely to have more in common...but if you're under 40 or over 60 and you think you're up for the challenge, then by all means). Race, looks, religion, occupation, politics, astrological sign, blood type, favorite football team, etc etc are unimportant. Marital status...that's an interesting one. I prefer you to be married or divorced...But, as with the age, if you think you're up for it, then by all means.

Turn On's:
A.) A woman who has a sense of humor as warped and irreverent as mine (You can laugh at almost anything).

B.) A woman who doesn't need me to carry the conversation all the time (aka isn't afraid to speak her mind).

C.) A woman with something going on upstairs (aka you know what synergy and resonance mean...or at least you're motivated enough to crack the dictionary).

D.) You're a fan of flirting and being flirted with. If you DON'T, let's not waste each others time.

Turn Off's:
A:) If you're somebody who thinks that bored people are boring, then carry your ass, sister. You're probably a princess and I don't need the headache.

B.) Likewise if you're going to be offended by my self confidence and think it's arrogance or conceit. If that's offensive or threatening, keep moving. There's plenty of gals who like self confidence in a man.

C.) Ditto on preaching about morality. If I want a lecture, I'll go to the aforementioned church and try that ice cream sundae.

D.) Nit Pickers. See A, Princess types for details. I'm not here to try and fix what's wrong with anybody and I sure don't need somebody doing it to me.

The rest of you gals, crack that dictionary, look up synergy, and drop me a line ;)

title: Looking for a date to this weekends Seattle Erotic Arts Festival

I have two paid 3 day passes to the Seattle Erotic Art Festival held at the Seattle Center Exhibition Hall this weekend. I'm looking to find a date for one or all three days of the event, which starts this evening. If you haven't attended the Art Festival in the past, you're in for a treat. Here's a brief overview of the festival.

During regular festival hours, you are invited to view the art and daily entertainments, from poetry readings to pantomime to acrobatic displays. There is also the Festival Store, where you can often find prints by the artists featured in the festival as well as other unique items and annual Seattle Erotic Art Festival merchandise. In the evenings, the vibe changes from a gallery to sexy art party. The Late Night Festival is a sexy, fun time with DJs, performers, bartenders at the ready, and a fantastically energetic crowd.

I'm looking for an open minded fun and engaging lady to accompany me and experience all the festival has to offer. No expectations or reciprocation expected, I'll provide the tickets, companionship and transportation to and from the festival , we can go dutch for food, any art or souvenirs can be purchased independently by each of us.

Here's a little about your date:
I'm 48 - See Pic
Got a good job and car
6'2" 220 Fit HWP
Easy going, charming, intelligent and witty with a bit of a mischevious personality. 

If you're interested in attending this event with me please feel free to respond and we can discuss the itinerary and I can answer any questions you have. I know this is late notice but I hope to find someone for tonight's opening and gala. No special attire needed just comfortable and sexy. You can check out more about the festival by searching for Seattle Erotic Art Festival.

I look forward to finding a date and haveing a great weekend.

I don't go anywhere dangerous or extreme though, partly because I'm usually carting a bunch of camera gear! 

So I'm looking for people who are in pretty good shape for those longer trips, but are also fine with the simpler outings. And you'll have to put up with me stopping occasionally to set up a tripod and take lots of pictures. But hey, I have a high-clearance SUV that I can drive, and I'll offer to plan everything, so you shouldn't complain ;) Or if you want to take the lead planning and/or driving, that's fine too! 

You should live near Seattle so we can easily meet for our trips, and we'd probably be able to relate better if you're somewhere around my age, say no more than 10-15 years apart. Other than that, just have a personality that's fun to be around :)

title: Didn't think what I was looking for was that different
text:
First and foremost, I'm looking for a friend. 

I've fished around Craigslist, and though I'm certain it is probably a bad platform to find what I'm looking for, it's also free, and an easy way to put thoughts out there. There are a few posts I've seen from guys that are along the lines of what I'm looking for too, so my hope is that it exists.

I've hit a point where my friends are married, have kids, moved away, etc. My circle of close friends continues to shrink, so here I am. I am looking for an amazing person. Someone to spend time with (when we have time), go out with, stay home with, chill with. The reason I'm not looking for a "relationship" is due to time, and the fact that I don't "look" for that. What seems to be everyone's hitch, is that I'm looking for a friend that puts EVERYTHING on the table. 

I don't like the term "friends with benefits", because that's not what I'm looking for, but sex is certainly on that table. Make no mistake, it's never to be assumed, since we won't actually be in a relationship, but you should be close enough and comfortable enough to express when you're horny. I will be close & comfortable enough to do the same, and when those circles overlap, we shouldn't have any issues having a blast, and not worrying that our friendship will dissolve.

At the same time, what if we are dating other people? Well, that's part of being friends. I can be a good sounding board, and hopefully you can, as well. 

I'm looking for a legendary friend, who can be a best friend, a date, a stand-in girlfriend, a listener, a debater, or even just a couch potato or drinking buddy, and all those things must be presented at different times.

Before we get into the whole "you shouldn't have posted this in this section", I'll shut you down right now. If this isn't for you, feel free to move along, but you know what? People have some serious walls built up around them (in this city), like serious, Donald Trump walls around their emotions that distance them from other people. When we meet, we're going to do it differently. Someone on here once used the headline, "Pretend we know each other", and I liked it (so I'll steal it). We're going to just jump right in the middle of an amazing friendship.

Now, the superficial part: You need to be attractive, intelligent, put together, not allergic or afraid of dogs, and adventurous (in personality). I don't care how old you are, as long as we click. We both should have SOME attraction to each other, because that makes for a great pairing.

I've had friends like this in the past, and I miss them greatly. Let's find it again. I don't require a picture right away if you just want to feel me out, but I will require one before I send one (so if you want to see me, send a picture eventually). I will also require one before we meet.

Crazy things happen on Craigslist, and I know I'm a good guy, but I understand the hesitation. Let's push past and start something amazing. 

As long as this is up, I'm still searching for my best friend.

Whew. Done.

title: 4/20 yesterday. Earth Day tomorrow. Let's enjoy today! - m4mw
text:
It's April 21, 2016, almost noon, and it's a gorgeous day outside! I want to get out and do something! Fun, action-packed, relaxing... I really don't care!

So here's the thing: I am trying to get out into the world as much as possible. My close friends moved away to different parts of the country, and the ones in the area have been so busy with their own lives. I too have been kept busy with work and school, but things are beginning to settle, and I have a feeling that it would be nice to meet new people. Who does not like making new friends?

I am pretty open-minded, love movies, and I am getting back into reading regularly. I'm finishing up my undergraduate degree, where I'm an economics/philosophy/political science major. Running is something I am re-learning to do (I was previously an avid runner), and I am training for a couple 5Ks. I savor the experience of food, especially Thai, where I cannot resist a good plate of pad see ew or pad kee mao. I'm learning to cook and I like comic books, so I have a few geeky moments.

I enjoy witty banter, have hobbies, and genuinely ask questions, so conversation will never be short.

title: Are you stuck alone during the day?
text:

I work at home, doing computer stuff, and I go days without interacting with any humans.

I am wondering if I can find someone else that also works from home (or maybe alone in your small office) in the Seattle area. Maybe we can find a coffee shop or library, or even a picnic table at a city park, and work side by side -- but on our own stuff -- and keep each other company.

I am open to getting to know each other over email a while first before meeting in person.

I would prefer it that you be in Seattle, or close by, so neither of us spend time driving or stuck in traffic.

title: Are you staring at your screen . . .

I'm hoping for a chat that will foster communications after work, one that will have you looking forward to the next email, text or IM.
If you're in between 35 and 50, I believe we can have a decent amount in common. If you're outside of that range and you're still interested, let's see how it goes.

title: Friends only
text: Hey, thanks for clicking on my post. Hopefully this is the first step in making a new friend. So, I know that this Craig's List and this section isn't really for platonic friends anymore; it used to be but I guess not so much now. However, I still have faith that there are still people out there, like myself, that are just looking for friends. Ok, I moved out here a few years back and I make some really good platonic friends on here back then. Unfortunately, they've either moved away to Ballard (you know some place so far away that they refuse to leave their new The Shire to come back to visit the old one) or they actually moved away (out of the area). Again just to be clear, I'm truly just looking for platonic friends to do stuff with. Absolutely no funny business. Period. I'm a laid back, non-smoking, educated, progressive, "lefty", black guy looking to expand my circle. Bottom line, I'm just looking for friends who would be up for grabbing a drink sometime, going to movies, running/jogging, soccer/flag football, working out, hiking, rock climbing and talking. Good conversation is essential; being able to discuss issues [and solutions] in technology, the environment, world events/affairs, non-commerical media, politics (again I'm a proud, educated progressive but very respectful of differing views). I know that's a crazy laundry list, but I'm truly open to meeting new, non-flaky people. If any of this sounds interesting and you're not a flake, please feel free to email me back. Thank you again for clicking and reading. I look forward to melting the frost and making some new friends.

title: Free massage (have references) and its m4w for a reason!
text:
One request: Please don't flag:)

So, I have posted couple of times on CL offering a free massage.

I used to do this quite a bit earlier in another city (moved here 4 yrs ago) and I would easily find folks to trade massages with. If nothing, it'd be at least a one way massage. 

It was so strange - for both my ads, I got very few responses...lol. 

Thought - I was doing something wrong so thought of seeking feedback. What would be a concern seeking a platonic massage through CL? 

I mean, Massages are fairly expensive so a free one should be interesting, right? As for safety, I first offer to meet in public, talk on phone and even keep the first massage as simple as possible - for example just arms or just neck. No full body or anything that'd make you uncomfortable with a stranger. I can also offer couple of references from my friends in NYC and now couple in Seattle who I have done this with. Not once have I crossed the decency line. I'm a gentleman with a normal life, job, education etc. High hygiene and to those it matters, I look decent too.

Why I do it - its fun really. Meeting someone new and the possibility of finding a massage trading partner is awesome. I enjoy the touch - giving or receiving but have zero expectations beyond that. Relaxation and the chat and the idea of meeting someone new is just awesome!

Overall, its full transparency so wanted to know what could I still be missing in my offer?

Any and every feedback is welcome - feel free to just curse me too:) Even that is a feedback!

Btw - I got a question saying if its platonic, why m4w and not m4wm - well when I was in NYC, I started out as m4mw and the experience was far from ideal. It was 3 out of 3 for guys wanting more than just a massage. Girls have been more conservative so its been easier to draw the line!

title: Married and craving attention
text:
I want to be honest up front - I am a married Indian man and I am missing the closeness and tenderness of a woman in my life. I really miss having a woman to talk to about the little things in life that we can laugh at together. I want to have a friend that I can call and talk with. All I know is I miss having someone to care for, appreciate, respect and adore!

I have been married for a long time, but regretfully the spark and attraction is gone. So I am looking for someone special to connect with. I am sure that there must be some ladies out there in the same situation that I am. Perhaps your husband is busy with work and does not have time for you and your needs and speaks a different language than you.

If that's the case, then hopefully we can fulfill each other's needs for happiness while staying married to our spouses. I'm hoping for a supplementing, private relationship in which we can make each other feel wanted and desired again. One where a married woman and a married man provide each other with the friendly loving we both crave. 

Naturally none of us should be into games or one-nighters! If we are on the same page about what we want, send me an email -- possibly to explore this discreet, adventurous new friendship.

title: Seeking Sarcasm and Wit
text:
I am tired of replying to ads supposedly looking for intelligent conversation only to be disappointed. So many precious minutes and possibly dozens of calories spent on wasted keystrokes. My poor fingers ache from typing what modern science and literary authorities could only call masterpieces of prose and intellectual ass-kickery, only to be met with shitty grammar and horribly spelled replies asking what my "hobies" are. My hobies!? MY HOBIES!? Slaying shitty spellers with mind bullets, them's my hobies! Pew pew!

So I've decided a change of tactics is in order. I'm hoping someone reads this, can sift through all my layers of bullshit, and see me for the poor, underprivileged, lonely, intellectually superior sex machine that I am. Cue the Sarah McLaughlin song... sad puppy dog eyes... pew pew...

So I guess what I'm trying to say is I'm freaking bored. It's almost 11pm, I'm stuck at work, and you should talk to me cuz I'm pretty much amazeballs. Like, a lot. I enjoy smart talks. Be liberal. Be conservative. Convince me why you're right and I'm wrong of something. There's a cookie in it for you! Be scientific. Be political. Be historical. Be an art critic, a music nerd, explain why you like your favorite band, and why mine sucks. Be brutal!!

But most of all keep in mind that at the end of the day I win. Cuz science.

Oh and I am often full of shit.

title: Something in between Broad City and Grace and Frankie
text:
I am in search of close female friendship. I have spent last eight years focusing on professional development and for a variety of reasons, my circle of friends has changed and dwindled.

I mention these two TV shows because both depict female friendship at different stages of life; a more innocent and care-free relationship, and a relationship forged out of a need for mutual support during a challenging life transition. 

I am not into the idea of smoking the amount of weed Abbi and Ilana do on Broad City, but I can get into the way they are silly, adventurous, and loyal. I may not know the betrayal of my husband leaving me for another man and having my life implode as Grace and Frankie do, but I have experienced my share of implosions and I understand the maturity and flexibility adult friendship requires.

So at age 45, I am looking for something that falls somewhere in the middle of these two examples. If any of this makes sense to you then please reply and let's see if we can be friends!

title: Korean/English Conversation
text:
Hi!

I'm a 25 year old student. I've been teaching myself Korean for about ten years now, but I think I've hit the limit of what I'm able to achieve on my own. I have Korean and Korean-American friends, but I always feel weird asking them for help because I don't want them to feel like they're my tutor.
Hence why I'm here! I would like to meet someone, either for coffee or through something like Skype, at least once a week for an hour or so just to talk and practice my Korean conversation. You don't have to teach me anything, just correct me if I make a mistake, as I'll be teaching myself. My spoken Korean isn't very good because I rarely speak it, I understand a lot more than I can say, which is why I need someone I can speak to who is willing to correct me when I make a mistake. 
If you're from Korea, I'd also love to help you with your English if you feel you also need improvement.
Since this isn't tutoring and conversation, we should have at least something in common as, if we click, I'd love for us to be friends. I'm a psychology student. I don't watch a whole lot of TV except for a few shows that I really love, like The Walking Dead, Game of Thrones, Supernatural, and Criminal Minds. I really only watch Korean dramas to improve my listening skills. The only Korean show I watch regularly is Running Man - I LOVE that show. Gag Concert is also really good, too.
As for movies, I really like horror and thrillers, but I'll pretty much watch anything.
Music - I listen to all sorts of music. Some off the top of my head are Beyonce, Elle Garden, Wang Leehom, Jay Zhou, Zion T., Gummy, JooYoung, and Junsu. I don't really listen to idol groups except for Big Bang, I mostly listen to solo artists.
I'm fairly easy to get along with. I'm willing to talk about almost anything because a lot of stuff interests me, so don't be shy =)

title: Roadtrip, camping and more partner wanted
text:
Simply looking for a traveling companion to travel the roads of the US.

I am a 42 year old 6' 7" tall 235lb gentle giant who travels full time in my classic motorhome enjoying the open road, mother nature and the freedom of life without anything to keep me tied to one place. I have prepared for another few years of traveling with enough food and outdoor gear to make camping even in the middle of nowhere enjoyable and memorable. I plan to put my/our finger on a map and just drive. To see the sights and to camp where we please both in the national forests of the US as well as in the cities.

The ultimate road trip across the states living in a fully equipped 32 foot RV rather than a small cramped car. I have a 7' long truly comfortable leather couch in front or the dinette turns into a bed if you are under 5' 5". If you don't mind co-sleeping I have a large queen adjustable mattress in the bedroom with a memory foam topper that is truly amazingly a dream to sleep on. A full kitchen and bathroom with a shower and half bathtub. Enough camping and outdoor gear to keep us both comfortable as well as prepared for pretty much anything that might come up with on the road.

See the sights of the west coast and beyond. No worries of needing to be anywhere at any time because we make up our own schedule as we go. Stay where we want for as long as we want...

Search the community rideshare section for the following to read more about the trip... "looking for a multi-state motorhome female traveling companion"

I want to spend the next few months finding the right traveling companion for the trip, getting to know them online and the phone and then spend the few weeks before the trip begins to get to know them in person by spending those few weeks camped out in the local casino RV parking section with them as a litmus test on our compatibility. If everything clicks then away we go on the adventure of adventures but should for some reason we not meld then "Que Sera Sera" and we part ways while still in the city and close to home.

Not exactly looking for a relationship but as in life one never knows what is going to happen. That being said, I am really nice guy that loves to listen and can give a back/body massage for hours so it would be a good start I think to something more maybe.

Look forward to hearing from you...

title: Bongo Drums
text:
Intelligent, educated, professional, WM with a truly wicked sense of humor and a flair for the erotic, seeks an e-buddy to build synergy and to resonate with.

I get bored as hell at work because I do the same thing over and over. Sometimes the only thing that keeps me out of the loony bin is chatting it up...texting, email, IM, talking on the phone...Hell it could be smoke signals (no, not THAT kind of smoke), carrier pigeons, or bongo drums and I'd still enjoy it. 

What I'm looking for is to make a connection...To have that spark happen when intelligent conversation and flirting are mixed together with the rush of meeting somebody new. BOOM! Explosive?...Oh hell yes! I love it!

So then what happens, you ask. Well, I'm separated and I'm definitely not looking to change anybody's situation while I figure out mine. I'm really not expecting that we hook up, date, or even meet for an ice cream sundae at a church social (I've never done it in a church, lol...Have you?). At the end of the day, I'm just hoping to find a gal pal who both enjoys some male attention and giving a guy that same attention. Anything beyond that...let's cross that bridge if we ever get to it.

So let's talk about you: A woman (sorry guys, nothing personal, I just don't swing that way), 40-60 (the age is just a suggestion because we're likely to have more in common...but if you're under 40 or over 60 and you think you're up for the challenge, then by all means). Race, looks, religion, occupation, politics, astrological sign, blood type, favorite football team, etc etc are unimportant. Marital status...that's an interesting one. I prefer you to be married or divorced...But, as with the age, if you think you're up for it, then by all means. 

Turn On's:
A.) A woman who has a sense of humor as warped and irreverent as mine (You can laugh at almost anything). 

B.) A woman who doesn't need me to carry the conversation all the time (aka isn't afraid to speak her mind). 

C.) A woman with something going on upstairs (aka you know what synergy and resonance mean...or at least you're motivated enough to crack the dictionary).

D.) You're a fan of flirting and being flirted with. If you DON'T, let's not waste each others time.

Turn Off's:
A:) If you're somebody who thinks that bored people are boring, then carry your ass, sister. You're probably a princess and I don't need the headache.

B.) Likewise if you're going to be offended by my self confidence and think it's arrogance or conceit. If that's offensive or threatening, keep moving. There's plenty of gals who like self confidence in a man.

C.) Ditto on preaching about morality. If I want a lecture, I'll go to the aforementioned church and try that ice cream sundae.

D.) Nit Pickers. See A, Princess types for details. I'm not here to try and fix what's wrong with anybody and I sure don't need somebody doing it to me.

The rest of you gals, crack that dictionary, look up synergy, and drop me a line ;)

title: Relationships Anonymous
text:
Well, you have a Valid, a very valid pointe. 

Now, how do I put this.

Sometimes we get caught in the Ego thinking trap. The thing is If we're seeking a relationship for either Pleasure, Stimulation, or to use the Pleasure and Validation to plug a hole in our Ego then it IS like a Drug.  

Drugs! with Drugs you have the High then you have the Low. So people seek the High to get rid of the Low. Nonetheless, one comes right after the other. Just the same as the law of Gravity. It's a law.

Relationships can be the same. When we meet someone who excites us it gives us that High. In fact the same Neurotransmitters that are stimulated from Drugs are the same ones that are stimulated by our Pleasurable feelings. Sometimes the high is so great that we feel like we're in Love. However, we're in Love with the way that person makes us feel, not really the person.

Then if we take too much stock in the Pleasure the Low comes and hits us hard. The Negative feelings can come and hit us hard. Don't you know, the Pleasure is the seed of Pain because deep down you'd end up missing the Pleasure as you find faults in your Partner. 

This is why some people seek perfection. They seek perfection for the same reason as someone with OCD seeks perfection. This is the Perfect way to avoid Pain, Anxiety, and all the negative emotions. The perfect man or woman, Perfect for me, My Mr. Right, these are all illusions created for Self-Defense. The Ego is constantly comparing and seeking to Identify it's self with something and that's why it wants Mr. Right. When The Ego fails to find Perfection (even if it is the one that is Perfect for you, that's a Justification), it creates Pain and Loss because it distorts the Ego's Identity. 


Are Relationships bad then.... Absolutely NOT!

No, we just go about things the wrong way. Has anyone really deciphered the difference between their Thinking Self and their Decision making Observing Self? The Ego, the part with the wants, needs, desire to get High off Life or Drugs, etc is all part of the Thinking Self. The Observing self gets completely wrapped up in the Illusion.

The trick is to see through it and see through the Ego.

title: Seeking Fit, Independent Friend to Lend and Ear
text:
Hi there!

I am going through a rough patch, and do not connect with most people (hardship or not) because I do not have children. I keep to myself and don't gossip. I am looking for a trustworthy and self-confident female friend who is out and  about in life doing her own thing. (I'm age 27-35). Please be self-confident, and for the most part, self-sufficient. Please also be in a non-attached state of existence (if you have children/partner - they are not 'accessories'). Essentially grounded, but always growing. 

 The wounds are deep, and my ex-partner's sister has tried to butt into our life because she is bored and lonely - she has done so unannounced. The nature of the hardship much revolves around this intrusion.  I will spare details on here. I have never been in such a predicament, as I am usually  doing my own thing and confront situations as they arise - as opposed to bottling stuff up. But life happens. and "People who can't communicate, can't communicate."

I try darn hard to see people as people, but there is an educational difference that creates a communication barrier in this situation.  If I don't do something soon, the sister and side fam will ruin me, as they are like vultures seeking prey and exhibit little discernment.  Logic would say to address concerns with each party, directly, but been there, done that. 

How did I get here? Well I gave someone a chance - suppose you never really know someone until you see them in a state of stress. When not around fam, the ex is like a whole new person (pun intended).  I'm very calm, do yoga, and meditate, and do not do well around people who belittle, shout, yell, and are not capable of setting and/or respecting boundaries.

I don't want to jump from the frying pan to the fryer and could use an objective third-party to provide non-judgmental, yet truthful insight and propose some real solutions. Not everything in this world is created equal. For what it's worth, I am not religious, but spiritual. So pragmatic, thoughtful, and somewhat spiritual advice is sough (i.e. no revenge seekers). 

Thanks for reading and I hope to hear from you!

title: Bicycling to California
text:
Why hello, everybody.

I am a nineteen-year-old male, and I'm going to ride my bike to central California in a couple weeks. I'll be going down the coast, camping out most nights, cooking for myself, carrying everything on my bike, etc. Probably average about 60 miles a day, three weeks in total. I'll be living in California for the summer, so that's where my trip ends, and you'd be on your own. You could come for the whole trip, or just a part of it. It's entirely up to you.

If you're interested in accompanying me, let me know. Male or female, it doesn't matter. Close to my age (let's say 18-28) would be nice. Preferably not creepy, sexual, or murderous. Just a regular human wanting to bike a thousand miles down the coast.

You'll need a bike, some bags, camping gear, food, etc. Everything you'd need to survive on your own for about three weeks.

I'll be going regardless. But having a cycling buddy would be cool.

Let me know! Tell me a bit about yourself, why you'd want to do this, what shape you think you're in, etc.

Have a nice day, and God bless!

title: Seeking a friend for the end of the world :-)
text:
Hello, thanks for stopping by. I'm a 46 yr old male looking for a female friendship, I don't care if you're single or married, skinny, thick, bbw, white, black, purple, alien or other. What I care about is personality.

Do you have a sense of humor, can you take a ribbing as well as give one? Are you open minded? Do you look at things and try to see the best?

I'm married and I've been with the same woman for the last 12 years. I'm not looking to change that, as I love her deeply, but the passion is gone, the dog gets more attention than I do. I miss that spark, that feeling when you look into each others eyes and the butterflies.

I want to start losing weight again and getting back into shape. I started a couple of years ago and was doing well, but after a knee injury, I slid back the other way. I live near Silver Lake and I've been thinking it would be nice to start walking around the lake again several times a week or even daily. It would be nice to have a companion to accompany me and perhaps we can get in shape together. It would also be nice to hang out once in awhile and watch a movie or just sit and talk. I'm currently self-employed and I'm flexible in my schedule, but most often have free time during the weekdays from 9:30 to 3:00 and occasionally on weekends.

I'd like a friendship where she understands my situation, perhaps is in the same. Someone who isn't looking to change my situation or me hers. If more develops beyond just friends, I'm not opposed, but I'm also not expecting. Friendship is really the more important factor, anything else is icing. I tried this several months back and met a couple of nice people, but one had opposing schedules, one got close to me and then apparently got  old feet and suddenly disappeared and one, who I thought was great after awhile admitted she didn't like kids and my son is everything to me. So no luck before, I'm trying once again as it's getting nice outside. 

So if you've made it this far, why not say hello. Perhaps we can chat a bit by email or kik and go from there. Please don't ask for a picture unless you're willing to send one as well, as I said personality is more important to me than looks. One can be a model, but if their personality sucks, they're going to be ugly in my eyes.

I'm getting a lot of spam/scam, so please change the subject to Cultured Pearl, so I know it's a genuine response. Hope to hear from you soon.

text: Hi!! Bisexual fun crossdresser - would LOVE to find an open minded fun girl to explore my girlie side :-) I'm into all things boy but also all things girl. Love sexy and cute clothes, leggings, cute nails and makeup fun. Let's hang out!

title: Friends to do stuff with
text: Hi. My name is Jonathan & I'm looking to meet some new friends. I am 34, gay, extremely down to earth, witty, funny, and super laid back. Pretty alternative in thought, & non scene. Can be shy at times, but never pretentious. Enjoy being a dork, but also can be intellectual. Way left. Sometimes misunderstood. Looking to connect with people outside of Tacoma's gay bar scene. Age, looks, etc etc etc do not matter to me in the slightest. Just be genuine and yourself. I'm cool around pot or alcohol (no meth). I drive, live, & work in Tacoma.

title: Anyone want to talk?
text: As we head into the weekend, I realize that this week has been a tough one. Trying to process some things and it's led to some not really great feelings. Reading through some of the things here either depressed me or made me shake my head in disgust, so I decided to post instead. Anyone feel like talking? I am *not* asking to talk about what's on my mind, but wanted to explain why I made the post.

title: Looking for weekday friend
text:
Hello,
Looking for someone who has same schedule with days off during the week.I work almost every weekend . Summer is coming and like to go out and have fun . Perfer someone over 35 to about 60ish. Single and like to have fun .

title: alki beach running partner
text: Hello my name is chris and I'm a successful 27 year old that just moved to the area. I enjoy meeting new people on here and I'm looking for a running partner to runot from Luna park to alki beach everyday at 910ish. I'm very down to earth, funny, and I have alot of free time to meet people and find some new friends. Any questions please feel free to ask! I'm very normal and I promise we will have fun! I'm ex army so I know how to run and workout. Let me know of this sounds interesting!

title: just looking for someone with similar interests for friendship!!
text:
ok here it goes 

I moved here from Ohio about a year ago.  I haven't met a single soul and don't see it happening naturally.  I am a super cool person but I rarely leave the house.  I am looking for friends who are interested in the same kind of stuff I am for great conversation and maybe eventually we could hang out.   I prefer to text but would rather chat a bit via email until i feel comfortable giving you my phone number.  Some day I would love to have a few friends to hang out with and actually see this beautiful state. 

So, if you like some of the following things and want a cool chick to talk to about them hit me up!!

Horror (shows, movies, books, art) 
Anything weird, strange, and/or dark 
Shows like Supernatural, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, The Walking Dead, The 100  
Movies like Star Wars, Terminator, Donnie Darko, Dogma
Anything Supernatural and Magical
Super heroes my favs are Superman, the Hulk, and Xmen
I am also very passionate about mary jane so I would hope you like that as well! 

so lets be friends

title: Seeking friend w/o benefits
text:
I'm open to friendship with a woman of any age. I don't care if you are short or tall, skinny or plump, plain or beautiful. For me it's all about the "personality".

I'm not looking for a level of intimacy that you would normally have between a boyfriend and girlfriend at this point in time.  I guess I'm hoping to find a friendship with a woman where we become rather fond of each other, where we both look forward to the next opportunity of spending time together.

I have no hidden agendas, ulterior motives, nor am I into playing any kind of games. I'm simply looking for friendship full of fun and laughter, and hopefully finding someone who ends up becoming my "Best Friend".

Please put "On occasion I can see Mount Rainier in the distance" somewhere in your email and let me know how far away you are from downtown Bellevue and the year you graduated from high school as a means of better identifying spam email from real email.

Thanks for reading this posting and have a great week!

Chris

title: Game of Thrones
